text: Very nice and complex Lambic. Aroma is quite classic - stable like hell. But it is surprisingly bitter in the aftertaste and it is very pleasant. I like it.

Sample at Lizardville Westerville during the Sour Beer Night event on 05/17/2017. Hazy orange-gold color with a medium white head that evaporates steadily to an outer ring. Short strings of lacing. Aroma of funky citrus, yeast and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of pithy citrus, funky yeast, doughy malt and a touch of earthy hop. The finish is moderately tart with a citrusy aftertaste. Pretty good overall.
Bottle. Aroma is less funky than regular geueze, fruity hops, pine needles, a tad flowery. Sweet malty flavour with a touch of hops and fruit notes. Good beer.
Importerad flaska. Bärnstensfärgad med minimal kolsyra. Doft av citrus och vitvinsvinäger. Sträv och träig munkänsla. Smak av citronzest, vitvinsvinäger och ungt träffat. Mkt beska.

Flaska brewdogs webshop. 75 cl. Grumlig orangelysande vätska. Syrlig och stallig doft av vinäger, citron och blommor. Mycket syrlig även i smaken. Trä, citron, jäst och harsyra. Mycket torr och sträv.
Flaska beställd från Brewdog. Orange med inget skum. Syrlig doft med aprikos. Sur och sträv smak

750ml bottle. 2016 vintage. (6.5% ABV) Pours a hazy orange with a medium, fizzy, short lived, off-white head that leaves spotty lacing. Tart aroma of lemon rind, white wine, cider, horse blanket, flowers and oak with caramel malt lingering in the background. Tart flavour of lemon, lime, apricot, brett, white wine, apple cider, vinegar, oak and caramel malt with a dry, bitter, acidic finish. Medium body with a creamy, smooth, oily texture and average carbonation. Awesome, full of complexity. World class.
At Cantillon Brewery. Tastes wrong. Little sourness, somewhat plasticky. Usually love Cantillon.

Glass from a bottle at cantillon. This tastes waaaay different then the oud beersel one. Pours hazy pink. Nose is faint cherry, wood ,almost no sourness. Palate is tart and sour and fruity and sour again. Wow, I really like this, just a bit too bitter, but it would probably be too sour if it wouldnt have the bitter edge to it. Could smell more intense too.

Bottle shared with the KL Tasting group. Poured a hazy orange amber with a fizzy off white head. The aroma is yeast, biscuit, tart fruit, light floral hop. The flavour is moderate sour with a light crisp, refreshing, yeast, woody, tart fruit palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation and a long bitter sour fruit finish.

From tap, as Iris 2014; orange golden color with a small white head; aroma is gentle funky, fruity, citric, some barrel character; taste is quite sour, fruity citric, fades into a solid dry funky finish with a oily grassy hoppy note; texture is slightly oily with medium to high carbonation and small body

Bottle pour at the brewery. Pours hazy golden with small white head. Fruity, citrus, wood, cellar, funky, sour, quite dry finish. Some bitterness in finish. Medium bodied. We were warned before ordering it might not be in best shape, but still a very interesting beer.
ok. not a lambic fan. super sour, taste lingers. has a dishwater feel on the palate. i know this is supposed to be good, i just cant.

Bottle. Vintage 2014. Very complex and vast aromas - barnyard, wet leather, lactic acid, caramel, gooseberries, lemon, grapes, funky, green apples. Taste is dry and sour. It all together really goes with quite strong maltybackbone. Medium to full body, smooth and creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is malty, vinous, moderately sour. In overall great brew.
Donkerblond bier met witte schuimkraag die snel wegzakt tot fijn laagje. Aroma van zure appel, azijn. Vineus, houttonen. Lekkere lange droge afdronk. Top.
Nearly clear amber colour. Aroma is sour apple and apricot. Taste is yeasty and quite sour. Tannic.
750ml bottled 2014-12-18. Pour dark yelloish orange no foam. Aroma is acitic. Taste is acid of coarse. High carbonation. Long tart finish.

Zapach intensywny, kwaśny, ocet, stajnia, cytryny, jabłka, zboże, kurz, drewno. Kolor bursztynowy, mętne. Piana niska, drobna, średnio trwała. W smaku wytrawne, średnia kwaśność, średnia pełnia, jabłka, cytryny, agrest, trawa, zboże, kurz, drewno. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie.

Pours an almost but not quite clear pale copper colour with no head. Nose has cheesy funk along with sharp citrusy aromas. Cant really detect much hop, well maybe a little. Very clean but still very very fragrant. The taste is rich with bretty notes of citrus and drying tannins. Juicy even and leading to a chiselled sharp finish and a fairly long aftertaste. I havent had this in a few years and Im pleasantly surprised at the revisit. This is world class stuff
Appearance: amber, orange, clear, no head. Aroma: berries, mold, raw apple. Taste: heavily sour, medium bitterness, light sweetness. Palate: medium body, oily feel, lively, sour-bitter aftertaste.

Bottle
Aroma-barnyard, floral
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam
Taste-medium sour, medium bitter, light sweet
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish
Overall-very good

Bottle sample at a tasting at zvsns place. Thanks tomer! Cloudy orange with white head. The aroma has notes of funk, horse farm, brett, some fruitiness (apricot, strawberry) and yeasts. Sour flavor with notes of yeasts, sweat, brett, rose wine, strawberry, acidic, a bit salty, dry. Soft carbonation, light to medium-bodied. Excellent.
Tap @ Himmeriget Copenhagen 3/1-17. Vintage 2013. Fantastic sour taste! King Cantillon!
Bottle from Jeremy. Medium golden with finely beaded head. Aroma of stone fruit, tart, floral. Taste is more of the same, light and effervescent. Finish is equally sweet and tart.

Bottle sample, thanks tomer. Hazy a bit murky orange color. Aroma is funky, strong barnyard notes, vinegar, sulfur, oak, wine. Nice sour flavor, lactic, funky, berries, white wine, wood, vanilla notes. Medium-bodied, smooth with low carbonation. Great beer.

Unclear, golden orange colored, small off white head. Aroma is fruity tart, some flowery notes, vinous, moderate soury, some funk. Taste is light+ sweet malt, moderate tart sourness, fruity and flowery notes, medium bitterness, funky, dry and bitter aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft+ carbonation. Although generally not a Lambic fan, I like the added hoppy and bit more bodied touch in this one, really nice.
(on tap, Cantillon Brewery, Brussels)

Shared at a tasting, smallish bubbly head, cloudy deepish oxidsed orange color, aroma of saddlle, sweat and sourdough bread, sadle and swaet flavor with biscuit and some mineral notes. Very nice and really mellow, grows on you.

Dark orange liquid, small head. Fruity aroma, sour, apple. Light body, little bit carbonation. Taste is amazing, sour, fruity. The taste of this beer is on a completely different level than anything I have ever tasted, and should get much more than a mere 10.

Keg @ In De Wildeman, sample size. Dark orange color, hazy. Frothy head. Aromas: sour, vinegar, woody. Retronasal its softer sour, woody. Flavor is sour with some bitterness. Light bodied. Low carbo. Some bitterness in the finish.

Botella @Cantillon Brewery/Museum, Bruselas 06/12/16
Color amarillo turbio, sabor agrio, notas frutales, cuerpo medio
aroma is sour cherry and some grape. flavor is slightly salty, tart and cherry. extremely easy to drink. pours pinkinsh yellow with no head. bottle share pour at kasers.

Piwo ma jasno-bursztynową barwe, jest krystalicznie klarowne i nalewa się z ładną białą pianą, która jednak szybko redukuje się do obrączki.
Aromat jest intensywny: stajnia, kiszonka siana czy klepisko, kwaśne nuty owoców cytrusowych i ziołowo-chmielowe. 
Piwo jest średnio-pełne i bardzo kwaśne, z nutami octowymi podszczypującymi gardło i przełyk.Wytrawne i cierpkie, a przy tym gładkie na języku. Owoce (cierpkie mirabelki, niedojrzałe winogrona) i ziemiste nuty dzikie łączą się z posmakami chmielu, o ziołowym charakterze. Goryczka jest niska, ale wyczuwalna.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Iris by Brasserie Cantillon at Osiedle Saska(2016) Fajowo delikatne kwiatowe owocowe mirabelkowe winogronowe bardzo zlozone malo tanin nieco winnosci, klasaRami Rami is drinking an Iris (2014) by Brasserie Cantillon Te ponad 2 lata zlagodzily kwasnosc, chyba podbily owocowosc, aromaty skorzane tez, fajne, agrestowo-cytrynowe dlugie posmaki, pychaRami Rami: Fajowo odswiezajacy, chce sie pic. Usto nie dretwieje. Food pairong ze schabem pieczonym do dupy imho. Ryli fajowe... takie... zwiewne :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle poured at home. Orange and a lot of of white head. Has the "baby diapler" smell. Really good taste - not too sour, tons of fruit - pear, peach, orange, pineapple.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Murky hazy orange appearance with frothy lively head. Smells gorgeously earthy with peachy, home-made wine notes. Flat as a pancake but tastes super sour and wine like with green apples, peach, barnyard funk and a rounded bitterness. This is a master class in spontaneous fermentation brewing!
Sample at a tasting event. Amber-ish body with a low head. Citrus, barnyard, green apples.

Amazing aroma of apple, hay, funk, gooseberry, grapes, vinegar, a bit of cheese (in a good way) and the only flaw - a subtle note of solvent
Great mix of tastes, low bitterness, a bit astringent (which is nice), a bit of sweetness and high sourness. 
Incredible one

Bottle shared. Semi-hazy orange pour with a thin white head that disappears almost instantly. Notes of apple vinegar, unripe grapes, barnyard funk, hop bitterness, unripe peaches and apricots. Medium body, flat, with a very sour and bitter finish.

On tap at Jester King during Zwanze Day. Pours a slightly hazy reddish color with off-white minimal head. Funk, barnyard, light fruits and must on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light bodied. Finishes with barnyard funk and some light fruits.
kinda amber/brownish pour, some foam. big funk on the nose. flavor is musty with some barnyard. interesting to try but not the fave.

2016 bottle. Hazy dark peach color with off-white head. Aroma has some fermented fruits, damp cellar, some vinegar acidity. Taste starts tart but also quite bitter and earthy upfront. Hay, barnyard, really rustic. Medium body with medium to low carbonation. Its a really interesting lambic but quite acidic with harsh bitterness.
2006 bottle. More balanced and funky. Dry, barnyard funk, not so harsh bitterness, long dry and sour finish.

At akkurat Zwanze day
Orange Amber, clear white head
Aroma of sour, cellar
Taste sour, fresh. Lemon. Hint of vanilla.
Nice organic feel.
hay, citrus, grass, basement aromas, earthy, amber, cloudy, minimal head, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness,

Pours semi clear peach with a very low white head. Aromas of white currants, peach, apricot, grass. Taste is fruity and floral with some herbal notes. Mouthfeel is dry and tart with medium carbonation.

Tap at Birreria Volo, and sometimes Volo. Pours like a nice scotch, a beer with legs, shocking for a 5%er. The palate is extremely smooth, seems to dissolve into your tongue. Some cheesy hops but also with lots of herbal hops. Dry as a bone and sour as you would expect, what a treat!

75cl bottle. Hazy amber orange with small white head. Funk, barnyard, floral, citrus and ripe plum and peach in the aroma. Soft carbonation and medium to light body. Taste is sour and bitter with fruity notes to balance. Some acidity towards the finish. Overall, a good beer.

Aroma: pineapple, grapefruit, barnyard, leather, light pepper.
Taste: light sour, leather, grapefruit, zesty, hay, spicy
Bottle. Hazy copper color with a thin frothy off-white head. Acidic aroma of apricot, apple and oak. Acidic, sour, dry taste. Medium thin body.

Bottle. Brewdog, Sheffield. Latest release. Bit of a gloopy pour. In the glass, its a hazy pink, orangey amber. Slim halo of white head. Nose has very ripe, on the turn and almost fermenting, stone fruit. Lots of plum and peach. Damp grain. Damp wood. Wet leaves. Some cellar funkiness. Further notes of baked apple and toffee. Smells fantastic. Taste is light, apple cider vinegar tart. Pretty dry, although theres some of the stone fruit sweetness on the lips. Mouthfeel is a bit odd, in that its dry and light, but also feels a bit gloopy. Not sure I can explain that one. Finishes long, tart, and slightly acidic, with some hop bitterness. Very nice.

Bottle. Slightly hazy, red orange in colour, no head. Aroma of horse blanket, floral, citrus and ripe fruits and vinegar. In taste tart, fruity, very dry with oaky aftertaste. Medium body, oily texture, high carbonation, lightly bitter with medium to high sourness. Excellent.
2007 Bottle thanks to Landon. Pours hazy dark orange, dried lemon rind, rose hip, spearmint nose. Light mouthfeel. Good carbonation. Medium sourness
05-05-16 // sample at Cantillon Quintessence 2015. Well balanced sour and bitterness. Dry and funky. Vineous and wood notes.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Bardzo przyjemny lambic, sporo tu wytrawnego, białego wina, dużo białych owoców, nieco miodu, orzeźwiające, podobne nuty występują zarówno w smaku jak i w aromacie. W kolorze bursztynowe, zawiesiste, ze średnią pianą. Smaczny lambic

Rating #1790 - 2015.06.28 - Farmhouse Festival at UBC - Draught - #babysfirstL00N - Pours a clear golden with a few bubbles at the top, not much carbonation to speak of. Aroma is Brett, floral, lime leaf, wildflower honey. Palate is quite tart, but refreshingly so, light-medium body, mouthfeel is like fruit juice. A depth of sweet and sour flavours intermingling. Exquisite.

750ml bottle. Bottled March 25, 2015. Tasting at Brians. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma is fruity, floral, hoppy. Same notes very bitter taste with lemon notes. Very interesting.

Fles zelf meegebracht naar IPA/Sour proeverij in de Vinotake, uitgeschonken in Struise BD proefglazen. Donker goud amber/oranjeachtig van kleur, met een opvallend volle witte schuimkraag die stabiel is. Zeer complexe aromas, typisch Cantillon, maar dan met meer hop dan gebruikelijk. Florale aromas, door de toegevoegde hop krijgt men een extra dimensie in deze frisse en complexe Lambic. Zachte, zurige en complexe aromas van eikenhout, gras/hooi, paardendeken, bierkelder, veldbloemen, dennenhars, en lichte citrus invloeden. Het smaakpallet is absoluut zuur te noemen, met een verfijnde subtiele hopsmaak. Met tonen van eikenhout, limoen, witte droge wijn, groene appels, appelazijn, alsook de bekende elementen van boerderij (farmhouse) en paardendeken. De afdronk is droog met een zacht bittere finish. De Cantillon Iris is een mooi elegant bier, prachtig in balans. Voor de liefhebber van de Lambic stijl.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75cl bottle
Aroma is nice acidic sourish fruity citric
 Taste is sour bitter fruity dry long dry bitter finish
 good body ,another really nice beer from cantillon

Bottle from 9/3/16.

AROMA: The usual Cantillon funk with a musty, dusty, oaky, woodsy, wet, hay and sweet effervescence. 

APPEARANCE: Deep amber, sappy and inviting rusty look. Nice tight foam and very oily look about it. 

TASTE: Oaky, sweet candy without being overbearingly sweet. 

PALATE: Very dry, oaky, woodsy, bitter, sour, sweet residing lingering tannins. Complex as hell.

OVERALL: Triumphant.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 The sourness of lambic with a definite malt taste and slightly stronger hops bitterness than your usual lambic. Good carbonation, slightest of citrus and funk and a nice oak tone. Bottled 09.03.2016, temp 5C, bought at brewery.
At the brewery. Pale ale malt evident at first in taste, followed by lambic sourness. Bit of a detergent aroma.

Clear deep golden color, white lacing. Muted aroma of funk, bittering hops, and lemon citrus. Taste is bitter with minimal tartness. Lively carb, light to medium body, and a smooth texture. The bitterness lingers in the finish.
Hazy orange color with moderate head. The nose is fruit and berries with a bit of hops. Mildly tart. A great beer and enjoyable to drink.

Quintessence 2016. Almost clear pale amber/dark gold with almost no head. Sweet malts and full floweriness with a light sour vinegar touch, fresh hoppiness. Seeds. Light sweet, medium sour, light bitter. Medium body, light minerals, oily fattiness, but less than others. Low carbonation almost none. Nice.

Color is hazy reddish orange with a near flat white head. Aroma is attacking your nose, with heavy funky notes, horse blanket, floral notes, ocean, algaes, kiwi, green apples. Taste is musty sour with a slight malty ground balanced with light bitterness, flowery feel, minerals, ends in a balanced sourness. Big body, low carbo. Excellent.

0,75 l bottle dough, barnyard, basement aromas, leaves, cereal, amber, slightly hazy, minimal head / No foam head. light sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, medium body, slick feel, lively, long finish,

Aroma of fresh fruits/berries with notes of hops. Semi-clear light reddish appearance with a small white head. Great Medium-high sour taste with a light bitterness. Average carbonation and medium-full body. Great indeed!
Bottle. Aroma is huge oak and herb, some lemon drop, leaves, and flowers. Tastes moderately sour. Big oak and lemon, lots of flowers, mild brett, mild funk, and a hint of vinegar. Solid.

750ml bottle pours out a hazy gold topped with a small head. nose is great a big barrel buggy lots of complex notes the hops have faded from this one. Taste is more of the heavy buggy notes a big barrel and a touch of fruit.

Pours hazy orange, decent foam that even stays for a short while. Aroma is full, fruits still intact, opening as a flower. Some sour and vinegary feel inside. Soapy horseblanket. Taste is also appropriate. Fruits there, sourness is adding to the enjoyment, musty and acidic, vinegar coming out in the finish. Very balanced sour that is filling all nooks and crunches I look for in case of a sour.
Bottle shared, thanks Jon. Wow, this is damn amazing, leaves me pretty much speechless. Very deep and complex blend of fruity flavors with a funky edge and a nicely dry finish. Out of this world!

Bottle (2015) from trade with Alex (Beermack) -- cheers, buddy! This is distinctly a Cantillon: from the first whiff I got the classic yeast aroma and apple-grape smell. What I didnt notice terribly much was any substantial hop presence from the "cold hopping". Instead, it tasted a lot like other Cantillon Ive had before. Good, but not quite sure I got the hype. However, Im giving it an extra one point for having a cool illustration on the label.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2017 2014 Vintage poured into a taster showing honeyed amber with a finger of tanned foam. 

The nose shows a big of pine and bretty funk. 

The palate is moderately carbonated and medium bodied. Pineapple forward with a moderate tartness and citric flavors of lime here and there. Same sparkling Cantillon tartness throughout with a slight bittered hop finish. A lot of flavors that all come together really well. 

2004 into a wineglass showing translucent caramel brown with sparse white foam lacing. 

The nose shows dry floral and cannabis notes with a round malty and tart edge. 

The palate is light bodied and lightly carbonated. Lightly tart with flavors of horse blanket and faded brett. Mid palate shows light cherries and finish shows rounded malts.

Bottle shared at Ratebeer Tokyo W & CB Tasting. Thanks for the bottle Jon! 2014 vintage. Apricot, oak, some almond and floral, grassy notes with some woodiness. Above average carbonation. Very well-balanced but with good sourness and high drinkability. Light hoppy bitterness on the finish. Fantastically complex.
bottle. Pours amber with thin white head. Wet hay, floral, sour lemon, chesse aroma. Acidic flavour, lemongrass, floral, butterscotch, grapes with hoppy bitter finish
Leicht trübes orange goldenes Bier mit mittelgroßen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch säuerlich fruchtig, spritzig, Obst. Geschmack angenehm säuerlich fruchtig, tropische Früchte, leicht holzig, lecker.

March 14 bottle in 1/16. Could have aged much longer. Light caramel brown color. Nose is stinky French cheese (Morbier), fading to caramel malts, old and floral hops. Taste is fairly malty for the style, with quite a lot of earthy tannins. Sour, but balanced and after initial tartness, becomes quite smooth.

Color arancio velato con riflessi dorati, schiuma bianca poco persistente che svanisce del tutto.
Aroma acidulo, leggermente lattica, leggero stallatico, legno umido, leggera polvere, mela verde leggera mista a susina acerba.
Al palato prevalentemente acidula, lievemente lattica, legno umido e polvere, mela verde, susina acerba, bell'amaro finale dato dai luppoli, presenti anche freschi nella ricetta oltre che essiccati, misto alla sua componente acidula che risulta molto persistente.
Nella sua coda fa capolino anche una lieve nota che ricorda il pompelmo.
La mancanza di frumento, unita ai luppoli freschi, a differenza di un Lambic classico, crea un taglio netto tra l'attacco acidulo ed il finale amaro.
Corpo medio-pieno, mediamente carbonata, oleosa ed astringente.

2013 bottle. Pours a cloudy amber orange with a generous lasting thick foamy head. Aroma of herbs, floral, lemongrass, perfume, some butterscotch, hay. Taste is of lemongrass, floral, oranges, butterscotch, white grapes, dry finish. Dry oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation.

1/11/16 750ml Old Notes (1996 written in Marker next to Iris)-Pours amber with a small head which emits an aroma of citrus, wood, and slight hops. Taste of the same with some sourness, vinegar, and sweetness. This light bodied brew is quite tasty.

Ein wunderbar klassischer Lambic, der einfach nur vorzüglich schmeckt. Sehr ordentlich in der Trockenheit, dazu ein starker Zug nach Essig, dabei jedoch keinswegs sauer sondern im Fruchtspektrum gehalten. Sehr zu empfehlen und mehr als süffig.

750 ml bottle shared at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Hazy orange color with off white head. Funky yeasty aroma, wood, barnyard, dusty, light fruity, citrusy, grapes, vinous. Acidic and light sweet taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The Lambic has got a cloudy light dirty strawy colour with a medium body and good carbonation. Aroma of acid, vinegar and barn. Taste of wine vinegar, acid, sour and unripe gooseberries, straw, hay and plaster. Very sour finish. Interesting beer.

Hazy yellow colour with thin head and steady round froth. Hay, flowers, vinegar in the aroma. Barnyard, vinegar at first. Oak, wine in the middle. Sourness of the citruses and mingeling on tongue. Really nice and interesting lambic.

December 31, 2015 - bottle from Brett via his trip to Belgium. Dark orange pour with limited head. Aroma was hoppy, woody, tart and citrus/light fruit. Taste was very woody with tart fruit and bitterness in the background and finish. Bottled March 2015. I have wanted to try this for a long time and made this my last beer of 2015 and first of 2016. Thanks, Brett!

Bottle. Murky burnt orange pour with an off-white head. Aroma is dry citrus zest, slight tropical fruit and a touch of funk. Taste is very dry, some tartness and sourness, kind of funky, almost no sweetness. Not the most balanced but quite tasty.
Leicht trübes Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Dezent säuerlich, leicht fruchtig, Zitronen, Äpfel, Eichenholz, spritzig, sehr gut ausbalanciert.
Perfect sour, probably because these guys are the litmus test for it. Tart wine sour white wine grapes. Oak like and barnnnnn. Horse blanket Brett. Flat head with tingle of carbonation. Great.

Bottle, 2013 vintage. Dark and hazy orange color, nice tan head. Aroma is barnyard, wet leather, lemon, grapes, gooseberry, lactic acid, hint of wine vinegar, light caramel note. Taste is medium sour, very dry, tart, light bitter and hint of vinegar sweetness. Flavor of lactic acid, funky, barnyard, herbs, orange zest, lemon, gooseberry, sour green apple, young grapes, small note of wine vinegar. Aftertaste is long, dry and tart, flavor of oak, lemon. Body is quite full, smooth texture for the limbic, light carbonation. Great beer.

0.75 l bottle from Bierkompass, 6% abv, bottled in December 2014 (1 year old). Clear, golden amber with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan to white head. Slightly funky, sourish-fruity aroma of lemon, fermented apples, rhubarb and oak. Slightly funky, sourish-fruity taste of lemon, fermented apples, gooseberry and oak, followed by a medium long, medium tart, woody finish. Thin to medium body, spritzy and astringent mouthfeel, very soft carbonation, almost flat. Very nice stuff, not too wild, well-balanced, but also not overly complex.

On tap at Brouwers Cafe for Big Wood 2015. 5oz pour into copita glass ($10). I have not had Iris for years, not since the lambic craze has started and the work to acquire it is too much. Additionally, I have never seen Iris on tap. Menu says this is the 2015 batch. With those factors it felt ok to pay so much for the beer. Comes to me with no head, a thick golden body that one cannot see through. Looks still. Once tasting it there is just a little bit of bubbliness to it. Otherwise, surprisingly un-acidic, un-Cantillion. A funky, bretty beer that is missing the Cantillon signature assertiveness. The floral aspect stands out because its rare for the style but I would not say that one could guess its actually flowers. I did not find this particularly more hopped but Fun stuff for an unblended lambic but definitely not worth all the insane-level hype people go through for this beer.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: 5oz taster pours a hazy brown color with a bit of head. Mild sourness. Bitterness overpowers a little and gives it a sharper flavor.
Smell is sour funk and white wine. Taste is prune, sour yeast, funk. Light body, medium carb.
77/77 beer style. Hazy amber brown color with small head. Aroma is yeast, some hops. Flavor is sour, acid, bit berries. Not really my thing....
Just brilliant one the best lambics in the world, unique taste , fantastic balance cantillon cest bon!
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Clear in colour. Tastes of both sweet red, and sour green apple. Powerful sesame aroma, and a bit "acetony".Overall a nice lambic, but maybe the sesame is too overwhelming.

From bottle. Pours hazy amber with almost no head. Aroma of sesame seeds, funk, weird acid/tart aroma. Taste is sesame seeds, lots of funk, dry, tart and sour. Not on par with what I normally taste from cantillon.

Bottle. Pours deep hazy amber with no head. Aroma light seasam, tart, earthy, green apples, barn, funk. Taste is sour, lactic, light vinegar, green apples, fresh and bitter, light hops. Quite creamy texture. I like it.

Pours a murky orange amber with a thin head. Smelled of wood, with a hint of hay, very earthy beer, barnyard funk, dusty basement, rotten tomatoes, and a bit of sweat. Complex smell, difficult to nail down. Taste is earthy and lime like. A hint of rotten fruit, and pineapple in the finish. M: Thin and puckery with minimal carbonation. O: Great beer, somewhat hoppy.

Fresh aroma of citrus, floral, and earthy barnyard. A bit woody and oak goes through, and its very complex with a nutty layer of flavour aswell. Taste has big brett flavors, passionfruit, overripe apricot with some hay feel to it, a bit nuttiness, and more barrel character than the other unfruited offerings of cantillon.

75cl bottle all to myself. Pours amber with a slight haze. Foamy off-white head. Aroma is brett and floral summer meadow. Taste presents a fresh bitter vibe with woody barnyard and floral, nettle-y brett notes on the finish. Glad to have tried this but not too into the prickly dry bitterness.
Light brown murky pour light carbonation. Sweet tart flavor with loads of wood and funk. Very well aged very wine like with some acidity. Finished slightly tart.
Pours a brown-golden with a creamy, tan head. Sour, woody aroma. Nice body with a soft mouthfeel. Flavors are much more subdued than the nose. Woody and lightly sour.

Ik had hoge verwachtingen van dit bier, mijn versie was eentje uit 2013, maar het viel mij toch een beetje tegen.

Binnenkort nog eens een andere fles opendoen en zien hoe die smaakt.
Hazy molasses, tan, red hints. Light white head. Herbaceous, dry darker berries. Oak. Bitter, some tartness, very dry. Lighter body, oily, longer finish. Good bit of carbonation. Quite good.
25.4oz bottle. Hazy copper color with a low off-white foamstand. Dry, sour cork, earth, oak & grassy nose & flavor. Musty, tangy barnyard notes.

2015/09/19 - Pours a dark orange- honey colour with a thin, off white head that reduces to a lingering surface film. Aroma is barnyard funk, oak, slight sour apple and floral notes. Taste is earthy hops, tart apple, funk and floral tones. Mouthfeel is medium with low carbonation and long, dry, tart finish. Really nice beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 19/9-15. Fruity, bretty and acidic with woody notes. Body is medium, the finish is dry, fruity and bretty.
Bottle (750 ml) @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 150919. Fruity, bretty and sour with woody notes, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry, fruity and bretty.
Bottle @ mikkeller bar copenhagen. Pours a golden colour beer. Aroma is fruity and sour. Taste is sour fruity and bretty an amazing beer. A dry velvety finish
Amber to ruby in colour, white not persistent head. Hoppy and caramel aroma, bitterness balanced by sourness and peach flavour. bottled 19/01/2015

First brew from Cantillon and first Lambic - Unblended. How do you beat that? Iris is beautiful and tasty in the ways that only Lambic beers can be. Lightly hazy orange color with a fizzy head. Aroma and taste follow one another closely. Stinky funk, acidic sourness, floral notes, earthy tones, and vinous grape. Few of the worlds brews match the class and character of the long-standing Belgian breweries. Cantillon is in a class by itself.

(Thanks, Adam! "AdamChandler")

Bottle.

A- Tart, slightly sour, subtle oak, subtle grape, slightly funky, lemon.

A- Copper color, clear liquid, minimal fizzy off white head.

T- Tart, sour, grapes, vinous, musty, funky, barnyard.

P- Light body, average texture, medium carbonation, tart finish.

O- Huge thanks to Adam for this. Saved it for my 1k rate. Vintage 2013. Not as sour as I expected it to be and a lot less funk. Contrary to what the style is, the flavors blended well, not that they werent supposed to. Would love to try this with a decade of age on it. Quite acidic too.
Best lambic ever. Sour tart grape nose, add to it funk grass hay and a brackish oak character. Super flat and green apple and more farmhouse flavors.
Bottle. Huge floral and real earthy grassy aroma. Minor lemon and fruit. Taste is crazy sour and crazy acidic with flower. Lots of flower as it warms. Not a fan.
Murky golden-brown with a fine collar, tart, earthy-fruity and faintly medicinal aromas, lemony tartness over an earthy bitterness, dry and juicily sour,
Bottle from capitol beer and taproom. Pours golden with tart head. Tart taste. Another great beer
(bottle) hazy, bright amber colour with a medium tall beige head; aroma of sourness, wet wood; rich, sour flavour with a long medium sour and light bitter finish

Awesome unreal green apple sour tart and peach aroma. No real head but some little bubble fizz. Taste tart and acidic. Some sour be easiness and sour Chardonnay light oakiness and funk. Perfect example.

Bottle shared @ De Heeren van Liedekercke, Denderleeuw - BE. Color: hazy golden amber blond beer with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: sour and aciditty domination. Notes of herbs and grass. Floral finish. Taste: good palate very sweet and sour. Nice beer. Astringent. Finish herbal. Aftertaste: good sour taste, notes of apple.
Perfect lambic. Lemon and barn nose. Tart fruity taste with equal funky cheesy and some oak walnut going on. Finishes tart crisp dry and sour. Could drink for ever.

Bottle. Dark orange color, very small white head, opened with a bang. Aroma of pure barnyard, with tart, hay and a little hop. Taste is really sour, with dry hay, horseblanket and a dry tart finish. Good stuff, but more malty and less creative than the other Cantillons.

Excessive head: a quarter bottle (12.7 oz) filled a 24 oz glass with foam. It settles quickly in a dome-like way, leaving nearly no lace. The brew is dark amber and fully cloudy. A softer second pour resulted in half foam, half liquor.

Sweet and sour as one might expect. On the sweet side, theres caramelized sugar and faint flowers. On the sour side, I detect mild citrus and some yeast.

The flavor is overtly tart. Lip puckeringly strong. The finish is a dry bitterness--I dont think its from any hops. No notable sweetness; this comes across like an unsweetened lemonade. The body is full while the carbonation is surprisingly light. If you like your lambics overly sour, then youll love this one. Perhaps the sourest beer Ive ever had.
0,75l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours cloudy orange with a low head. Aroma is sour malts. Flavor is sour malts and vinegar. Exquisite.

75cl bottle from Beersnmore, bottling date 18 Dec 2014. Pours orange with a medium head that quickly dies without any lacing. Typical lambic nose, but also fruity. Intricate bitterness, lots of grapefruit, acidic, but somehow it doesnt fit together in my mouth.

(750ml March 2015 bottle @ Brewberry Cave, Paris, June 17 2015) Pours hazy orange with a moderate head of small white bubbles. Aroma notable for its presence of malt and fresh hops. Orange, herbs, dried grass, lots of wood, sweaty funk, very lightly tart, with a bit of malty sweetness. Palate is fairly dry, with a hint of malt sweetness but also light acidity building in the middle. Lemon, a bit of orange juice, aged oak woodiness, musty, a bit of caramel, lots of grassy, even pine notes. Finish is quite dry and light to medium bitter with the woody older lambic feel quite prominent and even a touch of grain, along with persistent hops. Medium body with fairly light and effervescent carb. The barley malt and dry hopping really come through in this beer, I like that it wears its non-traditional lambic characters on its sleeve but still drinks as very Cantillon. Preferable to many average gueuzes for me, though it does not match Cantillons best fruit lambics or LP gueuze.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. 2011 bottle. Deep orange. The head builds as I pour it. Ends up with a pretty decent creamy colored head. Murky body. Hoppy with a citrus acidity. Equal quantities of maltiness and acidity. Lemony sourness, but nothing like other Cantillons. Malt replaces grain and hay. Hoppy flavor throughout blends nicely with the sourness. Malt flavor dominates the finish. Medium bodied, but less spritzy than other lambics. Medium carbonation. At first, I wondered why they messed with the malt profile of a lambic, because it initially doesnt work as well. After a while, though, you stop worrying that it isnt wheat and realize that its a delicious and maybe more balanced sour.

Tap @ BierCab, Barcelona, 16/06/15. Pours a hazy, pale orange with a small, white head. Aroma is sour, some fruitiness, vinegar. Taste is sour, vinegar, some fruitiness, light cherry. Appleskin. Just magnificent and splendind.

Bottle, 5 months old. Opaque orange body, medium head. Aroma has mild funk and some leathery notes. Taste is medium tart at first with mildly rotting apples and some leathery notes. Later the fresh hops come in, adding a certain bitter dimension. Now it really tastes like an apple that was left to rot inside a leather boot. The bitterness/sourness combination feels like bile. I think I would have liked it more without the "cold hopping". However, the base is still a very good Lambic.

0.75 l bottle @ Bier Bier, Helsinki. Nice dark orange colour. This is not as extremely sour as the unblended lambic at Cantillons tap, but still very dry. All malt base and cold hopping gives a hint of an ordinary beer. Not recommended for your first lambic, though.
Tap. Hazy, orange, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium sourness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, & bitter finish.

750 ml, bottled 17/3/14, from a trade with Orson0368, thanks! Shared at Bratislava Slovak-Austrian RB Tasting.
Deep orange, hazy body, with a big, unstable, frothy, yellowish head.
Complex, sour, tart aroma of barnyard, sour apples, sour berries, some overripe fruits, barrel notes, slight candy.
Taste isnt as tart, but as complex, very fruity, with sweet-sour apples, sour berries, sour citrus, sweet barrel notes, some ripe fruits, barnyard, some candy.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation
Finishes sour, but smooth, fruity, wooden, citric.

Very tasty! Extremely well balanced, sour, complex, but so smooth to drink. Very fruity, also some citric hops noticeable. One of the very best Lambic beers Ive had so far.

Flasche (75 cl, abgefüllt Jan. 2013). - Orangerot, trüb. - Nase streng herb-säuerlich mit muffigen Noten und einer Anmutung von Pferdestall. - Antrunk enorm holzig herb und krachsauer (Zitronensaft) mit Pampelmusenschale, abgerundet mit modrigen, schwach fauligen Noten. Herbe Bittere von altem Hopfen. Mild rezent, schlank, sehr trocken. Heftig herb-saurer Abgang mit reichlich Tannin. Langer Nachtrunk. - Noch extremer als gewöhnliche Gueuze, aber von Cantillon hatte ich nichts anderes erwartet ... Zweifellos ein faszinierendes Bier, aber ich muß es nicht noch einmal trinken.
Bottle. Hazy, orange color, small white head. Sour in aroma with woody notes. Flavor is very sour.
Bottle. Aroma bubblegum, fruity, orange, promising. Hazy deep orange colour. Taste is citrusy, orange, boldly sour, bubblegum. Refreshing, drinkable.

bottle kindly shared by Saeglopur at Slovak Austrian RB Tasting, many thanks. orange quite hazy color, small off-white head. smells sour, funk, some fruit notes, cherries, damp grass, light wood. light body, medium carbonation, soft mouthfeel. tastes sour, wood, fruit notes, citrus, sour cherries, apples, some wet damp grass. finishes light sour / wooden and fruity. quite nice and complex, a bit too sour for my liking.

Bottle at Shared Slovak and Austrian RB crew tasting 05/2015. Pours hazy orange color, beige head. Aroma is sourish, orange, alcohol, hints of solvent. Taste is sour, orange, lemon, wood, apples, hints of solvent.
Sour apple oak and jelly fruit sourness in nose. Flat no head. Flavor of cellar and sour wine grapes. Finishes perfectly dry. Iris is best unblinded I have had.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 Clear amber liquid with small head. Aroma: rotten wood, earthy. Taste: medium bitterness, heavily sour, balsamico vinegar, oak. Palate: medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
Bottle 0,75l. Pours hazy amber color with small white head. Aroma sour, fruity. Taste sour, balsamico vinegar. Not my taste.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2015 Bottle forom Alus Celle (tnx for keeping us). Pours hazy orange/amber with white head. Aroma is sour, fruity, raw apples, vinegar, some yaest, malty, slight wheat. Taste is sour, woody, oak, settiment of apple juice, medium bitterness in aftertaste,tobacco, balsamico vinegar. Long bitter-sourish finish. Medium to full body. Good beer.

Dark ambar colour, white head. Aroma of vinegar, apricot, honey, citrus and cheese. Taste is medium to heavy sour, slightly sweet, a bit bitter, dry and tart finish; medium body, thin to slick texture, flat to soft carbonation. Very interesting and nice.

Hazy orange beer with nice head on top and smallish lacing. Bitter and sour aroma, green apples. Earthy notes. Taste is really sour. Green zesty apples, lemon. A bit bitter but also quite fresh. Surprisingly full body and high carbonation. This has a lot of edge which is missing in the gueuze. Excellent and challenging, but so rewarding.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ & Friends during CBC beer week - pours a golden amber colour with white head. Aroma and taste is sour fruity, grape, some lemony notes, light grass and floral nuances going on, tartness on the palate, and a dry finish. Very nice.
Un très beau Lambic puissant et complexe, avec un nez très complexe et une bouche alliant fine acidité, longueur et équilibre. Un délice.

0,75L bottle (from beerExpress, Tallinn), bottled 2015. Pours amber, the head doesnt stay. Aroma is very fruity, citrus, lemon, some sweetness and vinegar. Flavor is sour and bitter, fruity, citrus, grapefruit, and acidic notes. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: great brew, complex stuff.

Amber beer, small white head. Nose is hops, tart and fruity notes, yeast, peppery notes, complex stuff. Flavor is also very complex with tart fruitiness, oak, acidity. Finishes with oaky dryness and hops, citric acidity. Gorgeous balance. Definitely not a quaffer, lots of flavor here. Beautiful.

Pours hazy white golden.
Aroma is intense yeast, white pepper, honey, mustard, white flowers.
Taste is sheer sour, very oily and dense, full-bodied. Bitterish medium finish.
bottle - pours light Amber. Nose is slight hoppy, tart, acidic and grassy. Taste is lemon zest, bitter, acidic, lemons.
Fancy bottle. Hazy look. Taste turns my face inside out. Banana. Earthy, but brutal gueuze. Dont let the lovely picture of a flower misguide you.

Very dominant lactic and sour lemon acid. Taste green apple and lemon with hints of stone fruit. The goaty and barnyard really balance out the acidity so well, generally better than the US counterparts. Finishes with a wet oak and hay.
Cloudy brown orange body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Fruity citrusy aroma with an interesting blend of grapefruit. Citrusy alcohol continues in flavour. Light-medium body.

500th rating! Long time want. Hazy orange with strong white head. Powerful aroma: floral beyond belief, fresh flowers spring meadows grass honey. This aroma is just so fantastic. Dry malt with dry grassy floral bitterness. Notes of cheese and oak.  Beyond the aromas and tastes this beer has so much complexity. The also has a natural character that is just simply lovely.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Pas mon style de bière à la base. Trop acide pour moi, amertume présente. Pas mon truc quoi

Bottle at Nuetnigenough, Brussels 14th April 15. Pours fairly clear, aroma is funk, oak barrel, musty, mysterious. Taste is sour, complex, oak, funk fruity hops. Carbonation medium to high. Nice complex Cantillon, not my favourite of the day though

Pours hazy golden Amber, thin white head no lacing. Aroma is acidic, grape, cellar must/funk, apples and berries, light mold / maneure. Flavor is tart, lactic, fruity, light sweet. Light easy drinking, sour fruits and funk. Lovely
Bottle. Pours golden yellow with a nice, small head. Sour, fruity aroma, very pleasant. Taste is moderately sour, barnyard, not very acidic. Light body, medium carbonation. Very good lambic.
Pours a slightly peachy yellow with a minimal white head. Aroma is barnyard, white grapes. Taste is green apples, slightly tart with a hint green grape dryness.
Bottle, thanks GT2, gold pour, white head, nose is lemon, taste is tart, funky, barnyard, citrus

75 cl. bottle, bottled in March 2014, poured in to a Flute. Hazy, golden colour with an amber tint. Big, fluffy white head. Sour, fruity aroma with lemons, wheat malts, wooden notes, floral hops, some grasses, barnyard and sour apples. Lovely. Taste is light sour. Medium body with a creamy texture and a lively, fine bubbly carbonation. Finishes dry and tart with lemons and grasses. Lovely, easy drinking Lambic.
the description pretty much says it all. not much i can add to what is already there.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Gold, orangish colour, delightfully cloudy. Kiwi fruit, tamarindo, loads of umami which is the only constant in an everchanging train of flavours: more kiwi, apple vinegar, tamarillo, the typical Cantillon skunk...an amazing brew, with the roundness that only a 10yr old bottle has. Yes, an amazing Cantillon Iris bottled in 2004.

Hazy deep amber pour with white head. Aromas of red wine barrels, Apple cider vinegar. Vinous and tart. Not super intensely sour or brett-y, good balance. Great. Some similarities to Flanders red style.
Excellent lambic, slightly different than traditional, orange dark orange hue. Great apple barnyard aroma, cellar taste of oak and wine with huge tartness in the dry finish. Live this one.

750ml bottle from BD ShepBush, bottled Mar 2014. Clear orange, small head fades quickly. Nose of fresh herbal hop, cheese, citric acidity, funk. Medium acidity, lemon, cheese, funk, very dry, moderate bitter, fresh herbal hop. Medium light body, oily feel, softish carb, loooong sour finish with all that cheese and lemon and a touch of hop. Wonderful.

375 ml bottle. 2007 vintage. BBE 12/2020. From some webshop some years ago.
Cloudy bright amber colour with a small off-white head. 
Tartness, sourness, red berries, acidity, floral hops, some sweet notes and mild maltiness in a wonderful aroma. Absolutely divine aroma. 
The flavour is much more sour with some tartness, red berries, mild hops, mild bitterness, vinegar, acidity and mild maltiness. Tasty and rather complex brew.
Straw colored pour. Big white head that falls quickly. Lacing. Sweet sour aroma. Hoppy and funky. Taste is a tart bitterness with funk and malt.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2015 Vintage 2013, vieillit un an. Bon goût de chêne et très acidulée. Longue amertume florale qui doit venir des iris. Pas ma préférée de Cantillon mais tout de même très buvable. Version 2007, vieillie 8 ans. Très sèche et acidité extrême et rapeuse. Très boisé, astringeance. 3.2/5

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a medium and slightly offwhite head. Aromas of some funk, some hops, slight vinegar, some barnyard and slight leathery notes. Some sour grapey notes in there aswell. Taste is pretty funky aswell, some sour grapey notes, green apples, hops are very present, slight leathery notes aswell alongside of some very barnyard-like notes. Delicious, simple sour.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 The typical sour smell. The taste combines a certain hoppy bitterness with an insane sourness. This beer is just awesome. Very lively carbonation that fits perfectly well.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 2014 vintage. Orange color with small but beautiful and stable head. Funk and hops in the aroma. The hops are very present. Cantillon funkiness. Taste is lambic, sour finish and with a lingering bitterness. Dry feeling, and with just the right small amount of carbonation to make it not boring. Amazing. A hoppy lambic, damn! A true masterpiece. And a great beer for my 200th rating! On tap, Zwanze 15 (according to Toni, the keg is not the youngest anymore): The hops are so much more present, as well as the pale malt backbone. Not such a masterpiece as I remember it from the bottle, but still lovely.

Bottles shared at Zwanze 16:
2016 bottle: candied sugar, caramel, malt, grassy hops, Taste is caramel. Creamy mouthfeel.

2006 bottle: wet cellar, black bread, way drier, more complex.

Both are interesting, but not as top-par as I remembered. My taste has changed.

Pours a golden/copper color with a fizzy white head that fades quickly. Aromas of earthy funk, hay, spice, floral notes, lemon peel and wet oak. Taste is fairly acidic and dry. A crisp bitterness couples with a nice funk...melds into a nice citrus tartness and earthy spice. Nice, dry vinous finish.

duft. hyldebær, fersken. blomster. svag funk
smag: citrus, frugt. funk. stal syrer. appelsin sødme. meget tør eftersmag

Barwa: pomarańczowa, idealnie klarowna (zamglona dopiero po dolaniu). Piana zabarwiona (żółto - biała), dość obfita, jednak szybko opadająca. 

Aromat: wyraźnie kwaśny, nieco drewniany z akcentami przysłowiowej końskiej derki, ale dość łagodnym, bowiem piwo jest stosunkowo młode. Lekki akcent ziołowego chmielu, który z czasem się wzmaga. Występuje także nuta cytrusowa oraz rozpuszczalnikowa, co sugeruje octan etylu. 

Smak: wyraźnie kwaskowe z bardziej wytrawną kontrą i goryczkowym, nieco drewnianym posmakiem. Goryczka zdecydowanie wyższa niż w stylu, początkowo trochę zalegająca i przeszkadzająca. Po chwili nieco mniej drażniąca. Średnio lekkie, raczej nisko nasycone, cierpkie i trochę ściągające. 

Kolejne "ksiązkowe" piwo z browaru Cantillon, jednak nie jest to klasyczny lambic. Został bowiem uwarzony z wykorzystaniem 100% słodu pale ale oraz dodatkiem świeżego chmielu. Barwa jest zatem zdecydowanie ciemniejsza, a goryczka wyższa i przynajmniej początkowo niezbyt przyjemna. Nie jestem przekonany co do tej kombinacji.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl à la maison, couleur ambrée, belle mousse grosse effervescence, une bière avec un nez houblonné et acide. En bouche gros mélange des deux saveurs, on sent lacidité du citron et le tanin. Grosse astreingeance super agréable. Fin sur le réglisse. Trop Bon !

UPDATED: APR 23, 2015 2004 vintage:
Well, yeah, this is one of the greatest beers I have ever had. Huge funk on the nose: typical lambic notes: barnyard funk, lots of wet hay. But also that smooth cantillon character that makes the minerality seem less abrasive. In the mouth the thing is just divine: tart, has a strange flowery subtlety underlying the funk which is just insanely well integrated to the tartness.

At a loss for words: a total stunner.

Poured 2014 from bottle to glass. Copper honey hue with light white head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is earthy, peppercorn, lemon, grapefruit, funk, pineapple. Mouthfeel is nice with a light body and almost no carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a bitter finish. Overall this is a nice brew.

2014
Looks.. Orange amber, sml head
Smells.. Fighting the barnyard dank are fruity hops, sweet orange citrus marmalade.
Tastes. Orange fruits and sour orange citrus, green apple sours, some hop bitterness.

At the brewery after the tour. Pours copper hazy with a medium white head. Aroma of citrus, floral, funk. Felt a little like an IPA to me in a way. Taste followed the nose with lots of floral in there and a nice bitter funk bite to it. Really enjoyed this one as my first Cantillon offering of many.

Thanks northopfrye for this gem. Pours a dark amber. Aromas are sweet and floral...I get a touch of paint in this too. Beautiful. Beautiful balanced sour flavors. Some nice sweetness, woody bitterness, and great sourness. Wonderful stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2014 2009 bottle. Peach body thin white head. Aroma of flowers and funk some cherries and vanilla. Taste is funky sour with a touch of dryness and sweet floral notes as well. A touch of bitterness in the aftertaste.  Fabulous Beer.
Bottle 75cl. White egg like foamy head. Color is hazy tea fruit color. Aroma is urine, bark, gooseberries. Taste is sour, wine, lemon, leaves.

Bottle 0,75l at Delirium Bar, Bruxelles, Belgium. Pours amber colour with a large head. Aroma of spicy notes, lemon rind, elderflower, peaches, some funk and a hint of catnip. Very acidic flavours. Some lemon pith in addition to the rind providing some astringency along with some more peach and floral notes. Nice high carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Complex beer with medium sourness, mild flower flavor, & tons and tons of barnyard funk. The flavor and palate are enriched by the hops, which are used more judiciously than in most Belgians, yet without becoming the focal point of the beer. Smooth. Perfect in the palate, with an incredibly long, sticky finish.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 750ml bottle served in a Flute glass.
Bottled in 19th of January 2010. By the way, a 6% ABV and not 5%, as described above.
A: Pours a deep orange to amber cloudy color forming a big fizzy bubbled aired beige head. Medium to low retention and many lacings and chunks of foam around
S: Sweet and fruity with the strong presence of the characteristic Lambic yeasts. Tart, but not aggressively 
T: Really smooth and intense. Mild sweet caramel upfront. You can actually feel the caramel malts and hoppy bitterness. Fruity, with notes of white grapes and apples, mainly. Metallic. Excellent sweet-tart-bitter combination
M: Light to medium body. A bit creamy and heavier than her sisters. Upfront is mild sweet passing through the tartness and leaving a pleasant mild tart-bitter aftertaste
O: Absolutely drinkable. One of the best Cantillons Ive ever had
[ BA Review @ 7/22/2012 ]
Sparkling orange hazy body and a white rocky head. Balanced aroma of malt and citrus. The taste is heavy acid, light bitter and sweet. Nice to drink.

From tap at Vices & Versa in Montreal. Pour is hazy orange with dense head. Nose is sour and funky. Green apples and citrus. Punchy sourness like all Cantillon beers. A long light bitterness stays on the tongue. Very fruity with unripe green apples. Tart and funk all along. Another great one from Cantillon!

Hipster OG, for sure this one is the OG if Bronsons. Unreal killer sour oak cedar cellar mold basement cheese... You cant do this in US as it take 4 ever to jones this one. Bucket list to go there and drink from the brewery!

En bouteille au Saint-Bock. Dun doré prèsque translucide, la Iris est surmontée dune belle mousse dune durée de vie juste assez longue pour bien se faire apprécier. Le nez est riche, funky et envoutant. On y décèle des notes complexes telles que le cuir. En bouche, cest sûre et ici aussi funky et complexe. Une surprenante amertûme se fraie une place dans le mix! La bière est bien carbonnatée et le corps est agréable. Finalement, les choses ne vont quen saméliorant alors que la bière se réchauffe un peu... Excellent.

Sampled at Where the Wild Beers Are, 6/7/14 

This is a really tasty one. Tart and funky. Barnyard and cheese notes are present as well. Some fruity (acidic) flavor too. Pretty excellent mouthfeel.

Pours amber with a large head.
Nose shows spicy notes, lemon rind, elderflower, peaches, some funk and a hint of catnip.
Very acidic flavours. Some lemon pith in addition to the rind providing some astringency along with some more peach and floral notes.
Nice high carbonation.

At the apparence this beer is light red with really light foam tipic of those beers. Its aroma recall wood and citrus and its sour taste it is persistant. You can feel the add of fresh hop drinking it at the end leaving a bit of bitter on the palate. This is a great sour beligan beer with which Cantillon perfectly mix old and fresh hop for a unique taste beer.

Bottle. Pours a beateful hazy orange with a tiny but stainable white head. Aroma has loads of cantillon funk along with flowery hops. Tart citrusy notes. Taste is sour with mellow flowers. Finish is long and tart with a very simple but clean dry bitterness in the finish. Body is tickling delicious on the tongue.

Bottle. Beautiful luminescent orange of a cloudy countenance with a charming little white head. Aroma is extremely fresh, floral and cleanly funky with citrus: absolutely delicious with a balanced sour texture on the nose. Taste has some bitterness, but is mainly ticklingly sour with a crisp funky baseline enhanced by a mild hoppy presence. Extremely good, simple as that.

Bottled 70 Cl. 

Pours a hazy orange. Looks amazing!

Aroma is citrus fruits, orange, white grapes. 

Medium-body, with lots of orange taste, smooth sourness with quite a bit of hoppyness to it. 

Rating number 10... Not a bad start!

"if only these were reasonably priced. ive liked just about every cantillon ive tried, this included, but they are so darn expensive...and this ones on the cheaper end of the spectrum. lots of tart funk, sour apple, high acidity. more complexity in the nose than flavor if only because the tartness overpowers a little.

Aromes fruitats de poma i pera, el llúpol aporta herba i citrics i el malt quelcom dolç. Caràcter de Bretta com de corral i làctic. En boca comença mes acida que amarga tot i que lamargor augmenta en cada glop i es queda fins al final. Boníssima!
2013 bottle pours dark yellow orange with low head and carb. Aroma is funky cheese and dusty socks. Taste is funky tart with a bitter dry finish, enjoyable
Draught @ Ranzani 13, Bologna. Orange beer with a bubbly white head. Aroma and flavour are tart and sour with green apples. Sour and so tasty!
750 2013 bottle. Thanks to Robertdale. Cloudy amber orange. More bitter than sour. Floral hops. Bitter finish. Similar to st gill and mamouche, but this was the most bitter/floral/hoppy.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden, nose is funky, floral, taste is dry, sour, funky, fruity. 3.8
Keg at six degrees north. Pours orange amber, nose is floral, grapefruit, pine, funk, taste is juicy, citrus, wood, funk.

Draft at Zwanze day 2014, birch bar norfolk VA. Pours a slightly hazy light amber color with an off white head. Mild dry tart aroma, citrus, sour grapes. Very tart flavor, sour grapes, funk. Oily palate with an intense lingering sour in the finish. Wonderful.
9/20/2014. On tap at The Birch. Cloudy orange with a white head. Funky yeast aromas, oak, spices. Tart and refreshing, bitter, fruity with a long dry finish.
Tap. Pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma is fruity, wild, citrus, wheat. Taste is wheaty, sour, fruit on the finish. Light bodied, crisp. Very good.
Perfection, dry yeast funk straw aroma with a pungent lemon grape thing going on. Flavor is sour lemon and slight red wine vinegar. Pretty different hop thing going on, yet made it better. A MUST
At brewery on tap; this wasnt for me. I little weird, though I am not a true lambik drinker. Aroma color; somewhat floral with a vinegar note .. I would not buy this again myself

-Backlog- Hazy copper with white head. Aroma is funk, lemon and caramel. Slick palate. Aftertaste is dry, sour and some nice malt sweetness in the end. Overall: very nice and easy drinking. Not to much funk.

Had this one at the source: Cantillon Brewery itself. Pours golden, clear, with a nice fluffy white head on top and lots of floaties (got the bottom of the bottle here). Aroma is straw, a bit of tripel-like funky yeast, some vinegar, dryness. Flavor follows closely with funky yeast, straw hops notes, pears, apples, dryness on the finish with lingering grass and yeast funk together. Very light bodied, super crisp, and pretty refreshing. Unique brew with plenty of sour, but also an interesting note with the addition of the cold hopping. Liked this significantly more than I even expected. Good stuff.
UPDATED: AUG 4, 2015 2013. Aroma of lemon, wood, sour fruits, barnyard funk. Flavour is vinegar sour, tart fruit, with a dry finish. Really wonderful Lambic from Cantillon.
Unbelievable brew from aroma to finish. Starts out barnyard and wet hay. Big sour grape aroma punches through. Flavor is sour ;peach and wet oak, along with pungent green hop backbone. A++++

Pours dirty brown with a small white wisp. Aroma is tart floral notes, with earthy malt and wet blanket. Taste is sharp tart bitterness but finishes smooth. Oak and earthy malt finish this off nicely. Thanks to Ezrangel for this.

@ Brasserie Cantillon
Plus interesante que la Oude Lambik. Les fait de travailler du malt Pale Ale lui donne une coloration ambree. La carbo est presente et forme un jolie petit collet. Les aromes sont toujours aigre et vineux mais viennent sajouter a cela des note de cereales caramelises. En bouche elle est plus vivante et un peu moins aigre.

Lambic made with only barley (unique as lambic is naturally a wheat beer) launced in 1998. The iris flower symbolizes the city of Brussels. This out of the box lambic is also partially hopped with fresh hops, which are normally taboo in lambic world. Thick, rocky, yellowish white head, brownish amber colour, darker than normal lambic or geuze, hazy. Aroma has all the agressive earthy, funky complexity of sulphur, hay, sweat, wood and fruity esters which are to be expected from Cantillon, along with a more caramel malt sweetness showing its pure barley character. Sour, very earthy and funky taste, very complex like any Cantillon product, but nuttier and more caramelly than usual and indeed hoppier in the finish. Very interesting, though I (conservatively, perhaps) prefer normal lambic or geuze with wheat.
Reallly great lambic....not too over powering in any sense. real balanced with green apple funk and wood. deep orange and mioslty flat...which is good for this type of beer...solid 4

Bottle before dinner. Pour is deep orange peach colour - beautiful. Aroma is a little less complex than the average lambic - mild funk. Taste is up front tang then followed by quite a lemony citrus. Hop bitterness arrives then finally sour again. Finish is bitterness. Overall, good lambic.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 Hazy orange pour with strong vinous and barnyard aroma, sour and slightly hoppy taste. Hops are subtle while a strong vinous character predominates this beer. For other lambics i will say they tasted like white whine or champagne while this one has more similarities with red wine. Barnyard taste is perfectly blended. Extremely satisfying. Pair with fish you will not be disappointed

1996 vintage at Akkurat, august 12th. 
Aged very well. Soft funky notes with light floral and herbal hops, earthy cellar notes. Very smooth and rounded acidity.

Bottle at Cantillon, june 20th.Pours hazy golden with a dense white head. Aroma is funky, floral, grassy and herbal hops, citrus and light barnyard. Taste is medium tart with a smooth malty, light sweet, backbone. Dry grassy hoppy finish with a lingering tart note. 
7-4-7-4-15=3,7
Bottle at home bought in Belgium. Pours hazy orange with thin head. Fruity grass aroma. Zesty taste, tart sourness with some hops. Surprisingly bitter and long lasting finish.

On tap at Mikkeller SF. It pours a hazy orange-red with a tan head. It has a funky aroma with faint hops, but the flavor is tart fruit and funk up front with a hoppy backbone and dry, dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at the source. First you get hit with the hop aroma. Noble hops. Then a cleaning sourness, sour dough. And the finish is dry bitter.

Slightly hazy dark golden with medium white head. Strong aromatic hops on the nose at first. Taste is dough, sour bread, lemon, wood, funk, hay, pine. Really present aroma hops like a lambic IPA. Very dry and sour with deep bitter finish. Medium bodied with very lively carbonation. Great stuff.

2010 bottle thanks to Mike. Pours a cloudy orange with small frothy off white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is strong funk, yeast, citrus. Thin mouthfeel with nice tart floral hop and light spice with lingering dry finish. Easy to drink, wow really enjoyed this one.

Hazy amber with a small white head.
Slightly tart aroma with fresh herbal hops and some light malt.
Taste is light, fresh, tart, slightly fruity hops.
Thin body, soft carbonation, dry.
Woody after taste with some bitterness.
hazy and dark orange color with tan head, fruity (plums), woody and malty aromas. Typical complex flavour of spontaneous fermentation. Wine-like taste and acidity. Clear sour finish.

Cloudy, hazy orangish color. Fruity tart on the nose. Almost wheaty
Mouthfeel, with perfect fruity tart notes. Just excellent.

Bottled 17 March 2014. Thanks to Rian for bringing this bottle from Brussels.  Funky horse-blanket in the nose, together with floral hops. The beer starts smooth, fresh. The bitterness and sourness turn in very fast, the bitterness is very intense and remains as a layer below all other aroma. There is a funky horse-blanket sourness, intense and sour with the smooth woody character. The aftertaste is bitter, fruity horse-blanket, woody-sourness and has hints of fermented hay. Very intense and complex, tastes like a wet horse-farm. 13/12/12/13
Bottle 75 cl @ home. Pours clear golden, white head. Tart fruity aroma. Tart fruity flavor. Hmmmm.

<perPerfection...dark orange almost no carbonation but just enoughg. Tart apple pear.Wonderful. A perfect example. hard to find true unblened lambics...this one pretty available. going down the list of the ones i can find
Cerveza lambic con muy buena presencia, sabores a sidra, sin apunas gas o espuma, ideal para acompañar quesos y pesados. Una excelente cerveza de una excelente fabrica unica en el mundo.

Bottle, 75cL. Home. A sparkling orange beer with brown hues. Medium white head, poor persistence. Thin bubbles. Fruity aroma (acid ones), wood, vanilla, smoke. Medium lasting sourness, refreshing. Light body, medium texture, average carbonation, herbal sour finish. Overall, nice beer, good sourness unusually "wet" : other Cantillon beer are dryer.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. About a year old. Pours a dense and bright reddy orange with a small white head. Nose is very floral and grassy with plenty of citric tang, moderate funk and orange. Taste is quite funky with notable notes of straw and lemon myrtle while the floral, almost herbal notes come and go balancing everything out. Grassy and earthy with considerable tang. This is a world class sour

Bottle from Proof. Orange pour with a frothy white head and loose lacing. Aroma of lemon, wood, hay, yeast, funk, orange peel. Tastes are along those same lines with a tart apple vibe and some vinegar. Solid even sourness. The palate is near perfect - tingly medium carbonation and creamy. Lightly dry and floral in the finish. Yeah, expensive, but very very nice.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

The Cantillon brewery is closely linked to Brussels, a city which has the iris as its symbol. As the name indicates, the "marsh iris" is a plant growing in humid areas. The historical center of Brussels is built on swamps where this flower used to grow abundantly. In 1998, the Brussels Museum of the Gueuze celebrated its 20th anniversary

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a murky orange copper with an off white head that settles to a film. Aroma of grapes and apples with some grassy hop character and some earthy and funky flavors. Taste has a tart, fruity flavor with some tannic and oaky character. Has a cheesy flavor and some earthy and grassy hop taste. Finishes dry with some cheesy and slightly bitter hops. Mouthfeel is crisp with a light/medium body and high carbonation. Wonderfully balanced and complex flavors. Very refreshing and drinkable. Not your typical Geueze.

Muddy murky copper color with a swirling of white head on surface. Smells of skunky funk, perm, spiciness of the Belgian yeast, soured fruit, banana, bubble gum, caramel malt. Taste is dry cheese like taste with a medium sour bite that dissipates quickly, some sour hop bitter at the end, citrus, some spice, a little vanilla and caramel malt. Maybe some wheat like flavors, rye. Good geuze. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to OldMrCrow for sharing these bottles of Iris with me on a lovely spring day. From notes. 
 
2004 (bottled 2006): Orange pour almost no head after first few drops. Aroma is delicious - grape must, citrus, horse blanket cantillon funky feet. Taste: some breadiness, a bit of leather, super super tart. No real carbonation, slick lemony coating -- a lot of lemon/apple. Some sweet tarts if I leave it swirling in my mouth for a long, long time, which ultimately ends with a huge lemon citrus tart wave that makes me almost want to cry. Pears, cheese. Some sediment. Really musty, pear, funky and citrusy. After OldMrCrow mentions it, theres an undercurrent of a sulphuric old rubber. Really fantastic.
 
Fresh(ish) batch (bottled 2013): Well this is totally different. Appearance: Creamy white head with fine lacing. Sediment in there. Somewhat darker orange-amber. Aroma: dandelion (think pissenlet), soap - herbal hops dominate the aroma here. Taste: Way less tart, but still finishes all nice and funky. Not as "extreme" on the funk side as the old bottle, but more interesting with the hops -- to the extent hop presence indicate freshness, this is clearly the fresher of the 2. Theres an element of freshly cut hay in the aroma that I cant get enough of. Also sweeter than the 2004.
 
I can see the appeal to having a deep lambic cellar. Sometimes you want to be outside in the field, and sometimes you want to sit your ass inside with some musty old books. Beautiful beer at either age.

Opaque orange without any foam head whatsoever. Aroma is vinager like, some sour fruits. You have to get used to this taste every time again, sourish, vinegar like, but still quite interesting. (Velp 201406)

I ve been wanting this beer for years and the day finally came at WWBA! pours orange with nose of vinegar and barnyard. Tastes of flowers, pine, horseblanket, yeast, wood, and vinegar. its tart and dry. very nice. mission accomplished
Bottle pour. Murky, light brown. Super funky nose. Sweet. Orange notes. Taste is more strait forward. Very tart. Makes you pucker. Some oak. Lightens I just a bit at the end.
750ml bottle at 6%. Pours dark orange with no head. Aroma is sweet candy sugars and light barnyard notes. Taste has toffee to start, with a sour cheesiness throughout.
Sour/acid taste, a little bit amber color, a little carbonation also. Flavor remainds cheese combined with a dubbel beer. Some fruitness can be felt in the aroma. Peachy color.
Amazing gueuze lambic, very complex and full of different tastes, so enjoyable, very sour, grains, cereals, wild fruity and flowery notes. Lots of flowers. Niceee
shared bottle. poured verry viscous! amber orange coloured with a white head. funk, grapes, green apples, hop bitternes!, earth, not the best cantillon for me. should try it again with some age on it

A different unblinded lambic than most in my area. Nevertheless it is fantastic. Musty, cellar old wine barrel aroma and flavir. Green apple sours, and slight peach. Very full body, for a lambic. Nothing like this one, so much with this beer.

At the brewery pours a hazy amber color with a small light tan head. The smell is fruity malt, must, mild sour notes. The taste is initially must with a bit of sweetness then turning very sour and a bitter hoppy end. Light yet so bit oily in body with nice fine carbonation.
Bottiglia da 75 cl 2013, Cantillon non si smentisce mai, fantastico labbinamento tra acidità e lerbaceo dei luppoli freschi. Capolavoro
Bottle share thanks to DrewFace. Aroma is sour, tart, floral. Taste is not as sour, almost malty, not nearly as sour as other cant lions.
More malt on the nose than I expected. Still very sour in taste but not over bearing.
Very clear dark orange pour. Farmy fruity sweet tart. More apricot like fruit flavor, tart, lightly sweet,crisp. Yummm.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; burnished amber pour with a creamy beige head, nice funky aroma, taste has grape, citrus, quite vinous, sour, some orange, very good.

Straw and musty sourness without the higher aromatic qualities of some of their other brews. A harsh bit of chlorophylls and dung in the finish punctuated by a burning sourness. Inetersting, challening and... Ill stop there.

Bottle @ home. More body than your average Cantillon and with more happening in regards to mouthfeel and palate.. Grape, earthiness and herbality from the gentle hops. Nothing spectacular but all in all a quality beer (to no surprise)

Amber leaning towards copper pour, nearly clear, with a thin off-white head. Very funky nose, featuring a lot of horse blanket and some lactic notes with some woodiness and herbal notes. Theres a certain light hoppiness as well with faint citrus notes. Im getting a recently rained upon forest floor sort of notion from the nose as well. Quite sour across the palate with lots of wood and lactic flavours. Lacking some of the complexity shown on the nose but still very interesting. Incredibly dry as well which detracts from the mouthfeel for me.

4 ounces on draft at Pizzeria Paradiso Dupont. Pours a dark caramel brown color with off-white head. Aromas of vinegar, wine, tart fruit. Tasting notes of vinegar, wine, tart fruit, floral notes, herbs. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Pretty tasty.

Bottle @Theis. Pours unclear orange with a lasting and lacing medium off-white head. Aroma is leather, fresh flowers, sour fruit, grass, apple, wood and horse blanket. Taste is light+ sweet, bitter and tart. Body is light+, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes dry and bitter with a nice bite.
Sampled @ Zeebra 2014. Very sour, more sour tha the hommage. Bitter, as well. Not really my cup of tea.

Opened a batch two bottling of Iris (offset label/2000 cork) at the JF Vonck tasting in NYC, 2/14. The beer has held up extremely well, the age hasnt detracted much if at all from the overall essence of what the beer was meant to be. Having had nearly all of the other available Iris vintages (Including a batch one shared with Steve K in 2010- Thanks Todd!), it was evident in the 2000 vintage that age can make things a bit murkier, a bit darker in color and perhaps more full bodied, while still retaining funk and developing more earthiness for well over a decade. The older examples of Iris, all the way up to 2003 375ml, seem to exhibit a sort of profound stoic funkiness with a firm acidity- though not bracing or bright by any means. A subdued, hazy treat to enjoy with your thinking cap on, this certainly stretches the definition of what dark, unblended lambic can be.
Bottle sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours cloudy orange/amber with white head. Spicy aroma. Taste is sour and spicy.

Absolutely awesome to get a couple splashes of this. Sure didnt take any notes, but this was dry, refreshing, the right amount of tart, with nice fruity and floral notes. So drinkable yet plenty of things to ruminate over with each sip. Hope to revisit sometime.

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy medium amber, with a medium-large off-white head, which lasts well and leaves reasonable lacing. Earthy, oaky notes and worn leather mix with mild sourness and floral hops to create the aroma. Potent citric sourness and mild floral hops up front give way to oak, leather and a savoury touch in the mid-palate. The finish is like biting straight into a piece of ruby grapefruit, with powerful sourness and acidity. This is certainly one of the most sour lambics I have had, yet still very complex and highly enjoyable.

Ive become rather fond of lambic beer over the last few years. And this beer is pretty much the reason why. I dont think I can say anything that hasnt been said before, other than I think it is experiences like this beer which fuels ones life.

Thanks for this buckeye boy. Pours a light orange hue with a small white head. Nose gives hints of oak and cork. Taste is apricot and coriander with some spice.  Super funky like only a Cantillon. Amazing beer

10 years old. Vintage 2004 (bottled 2006) shared with prufrockstar.

Ive been sitting on this one for years waiting for just the right occasion, and this is it -- a long sunny weekend afternoon, the first warm one of the year. The bottle opens with a weak puff, and pours yellow tan, slightly hazy, close to still. The aroma is divine -- unmistakably Cantillon, characteristic dry rubber. Hugely funky in that Cantillon way, amazing fruitiness, hard to place but Im going to say Asian pear. Spectacular. The flavor is almost startlingly leathery at first, not quite as sour and much less fruity than expected from the aroma, lemon juice of course but even more very chewy, very dry. Totally delicious especially as the palate acclimates. Lack of carbonation is not a problem on the tongue. I think the acidity compensates. Lovely beer. 10/4/8/4/18=4.4.

3 years old. Vintage 2011 (Bottled 2013) shared with prufrock.

Pours just slightly darker than the older bottle, with an expansive if short-lived white head. Aroma is totally different from the 2004: explosive herbal (mint? not quite) notes from the hops, recalling fresh(er) Orval. Much less leather than the 2004, instead a sweet-ish grapefruit pith. Compared to the old bottle, the mouthfeel is downright spritzer-ish. This is quite a bit more approachable than the older one, but doesnt soar to the same heights 9/4/8/4/17=4.2. 

tl;dr summary: Aging loons is worthwhile, but try em fresh first.

Bottle 750 ml at home, 2011 vintage. Poured into a tulip, ABV 6%
Pours a deep orange golden colour, with a clear body and a big soapy head on top, off-white in colour with good retention, leaving light lacing on the glass/
Aroma is grape-y, with wood and cork notes, just a tiny bit of funkyness.
Quite sour and acidic taste with white grapes, lemon leaves, nice bitterness on the aftertaste. Tart on the palate and very tangy too, average carbonation.
Overall nice and refreshing, maybe a bit too tangy though.

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, vinegar, barnyard and brett. Sweet and acidic flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery texture and soft carb. A very nice and crisp Sour.
Acidity, fruity, funky, lovely, hazy colour, medium white head, lacing. Big tartness, funky, yeasty, slightly bready, very nice indeed!

Pleased to get this on Keg at Craft100. Hazy orange with a big foamy head. Aroma of apple peel, lemon, sour sherbert. Body is medium, slightly foamy, carbonation is medium. Taste is sour, apple, orange, lemon, metallic, acidic, long dry finish. A slow drinker. Nice flavour but I generally dont like the palate of lambics and this is no exception - my teeth feel like theyre going to fall out.

Bottle at Nüetnigenough, Brussels. Amber color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, tart, hops, mango, toast and a bit of acidic notes. Sour finish with peach, hops, tart and acidic notes. Exquisite lambic.
Draught. Hazy amber with a thin head. Aroma is acidic and wood. Flavour is apple, zesty wood on a long dry mouth finish

Among the lighter Cantillons that Ive had but thats by no means a bad thing. Pours clear ruby without much head or lacing. Crackery Cantillon yeast with grapefruit and sour plum aromas. More watery than other Cantillons. Finishes lightly sour. Tap at Churchkey.

[2013] 75cl bottle. Thanks to Craig for this one. Hazy copper with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are apples, lemon, grapes, cheese, oak, funk and hay with earthy, floral and spicy notes. Perfectly sour, tart and bitter. Light body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.
Bottle at cantillon brewery, brussels. Bronze color, small white head. Fruity sour aroma. Sour taste, fruity, dry, yeasty.

Pours a hazy copper with a small-ish white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of spicy hops, wet hay and light funk. The hops seem a lot fresher than other bottles Ive had of this before. Taste is tart and refreshing, hoppy. Citrusy flavors ride over a juicy backbone. Finish is spicy and lightly bitter. Body is medium, mouthfeel lean. Carbonation is moderate. Overall a really, really nice lambic base and the hoppy aromas and flavors simply push it into the "awesome" territory. This is one to come back to again, and again, and again...
