1998, Thank you Eric for sharing. Poured into a wine glass, murky orange with a thing layer of head. Floral and earthy with a citrus tartness that lingered. Really aged well and my preference over fresh

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2015 Hazy tan orange in color... Aroma of caramel, oak, citrus tartness... Flavor is earthy malts, spices, oak, cherry on the palate... Funk on finish... Amazingly good

Combined rating as I initially enjoyed this in 2009... Original rating from beer log from 2009 Belgian Trip.... Orange tan in color, aroma is less sour than other lambics, flavor is more malty than other lambics but still has that characteristic sourness of lambics, malt flavor gives it more balance, can taste hints of oak on palate... Great beer

Bottiglia 75cl, ordinata su birraland e bevuta a casa.
Ambrata con schiuma fine e persistente.
Meno acida di una lambic comune, molto amara e luppolata sul finale, equilibrio fantastico.
Deliziosa.
Nice dirty musty moldy tart and lemony lambic here. I loved that it had carbonation which i wasnt expecting. Moldy cheese, lemon, light balsamic, and oak with maybe some light herbal hoppiness.
This one is different from the 'regular' lambic based beers. The hops make the finish less aciding, making it not so tart. Quite good when you're in the mood.

Whoa, Im not worthy. Amazingly complex, the closest beer Ive had to this was from Hill Farmstead. At one time sour, then dry, then sweet, then bitter, crazy. Effervescent in the pour, saison like. Beautiful enticing color. The finish is palate cleansing, tickles the throat with the tight carbonation. Dont know if it is something I would necessarily want on a daily basis, but for a treat once in awhile this is lovely.
2007 bottle, huge flavors, tons of nuances, awesome flavors, I really like this, plus one for cantillon

Draft at Max?s Belgian Beer Festival. Pours almost clear copper with no head. Tastes very tart and slightly sour, like strong grapefruit, yeast, and cheese. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like fermentation, wheat, and creamy cheese, with a light hint of floral citrus.

Bottle 0.75l. Pours a hazy deep orange with medium white head. Aroma has vinegar, apples, funky. Taste is heavily sour, almost no sweetness, bitter notes, vinegary, green apples, hops. Aftertaste is tart with some good bitterness which makes the beer very well balanced. Excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 750ml capped and corked green bottle, 2013 years vintage labelled 6% ABV, with a classy looking label with a painting of an Iris flower. Poured into a stem glass., the appearance is opaque persimmon colored with a medium sized beige head that reduced fast but left a lasting thick small head. Aroma of overripe apples, table grapes and vinegar. Flavour of overripe apples, lemon peels, table grapes and vinegar. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, and heavy on sourness. Palate is light-medium bodied, smooth texture and soft carbonation. Excellent, full of flavour despite the relatively low ABV, one of the best Lambic style beers I have tasted.
Bottle 75 ml. One of the best sours I have had. Very complex with a lot going in. Hard to explain, especially when you are a bit tipsy, so all I can do is to recommend it.

En vän till mig sa att det här var ett hajpat bryggeri, jag vet inte riktigt om jag håller med. Visst snackas det en hel del om Cantillon och hur bra öl de gör men å andra sidan så gör de faktiskt riktigt bra öl! Hajpat eller inte så var det här en riktigt bra och välbalanserad öl med friska och syrliga inslag.

2011 vintage bottle from Japan. Pours a dirty orange-brown with tons of (short lived) head. Murky, ugly color thereafter. 

Nose of funky lambic and aged hops. Unique profile among other Loons; the hops really take it in a different direction. So dry, plenty of funk. Hearty sourness kept in check by the hops. Interesting, though not my preference.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma of sourness/tartness, barnyard and musky notes, caramel and pale malts, some light fruits, and light spices. Flavor a great blend of the sour and funky notes and a Belgian beer. Average texture. A good beer from Cantillon, obviously.

Bottled in January 2011. Przepiekne i stylistycznie klasowe piwo. Ciezkie tresciwe i cierpkie. Goryczkowe i aromatyczne, przypominal zapach makow na lace. Wiosenne skojarzenia i z czysta natura kojarzyl mi sie ten artystyczny lambick. Niefiltrowany i niepasteryzowany, surowy i metny, ze spora piana ale ustepujaca dosc szybko jak to w szampanach. Stylistyczna i artystyczna etykieta. 2 lata dojrzewania w browaze w beczkach zrobily swoje, a ja jeszcze dolozylem 3 lata w mojej piwniczce. Smak cierpkisci i kwasowosci dlugo nam towarzyszy i w ustach przez bardzo dlugi czas pozostaje. Klasa, ale zarezerwowana tylko dla zawodowcow piwnych, amatorzy niech sie trzymaja z daleka bo nie docenia tego piwa wogole.

[1 Feb-tripp till Mikkeller] Eufori i flaska på en hypad plattform av tellus grönskande säd?! Aromen är frisk och fruktig. Cantillon må vara ett av de mest hype:ade bryggerierna men det här är bra bryggt med balansen på de syrliga och fruktiga tonerna

On tap at The Holy Grale, Louisville Ky. Dark amber. Small head. Low carbonation. Sour. Light texture, thin, clean finish . I am a IPA guy maybe you should take my review with a grain of salt but I dont like this beer. I tried it because of the reputation of Cantillon. I know it was sour but sour is really its only notable Quality.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a light amber with fizzy off white head. Nose shows sour tartness, lemon and a barnyard type funk. Taste is much the same, sour acidity with citrus upfront with a dry refreshing finish. Very quaffable!

Bottle from P&M-Getränke. Beautiful subtle, big head, with an ember orange, nearly brown color.

Zippy, sour, fruity aromas, with hints of malt, also smells a bit funky.

Intense sourness from the very beginning, but more complex than the usual lambic with the help of malt flavors in it. Malt gets even more intense in the end, makes the beer less bitter, and creates a very interessting taste. Creates a vivid, tart mouthfeel. Sour notes get stronger in the the end, with a long aftertaste, but is at no point too intense, saves some space on my palate for hints of malt, which turns more bready in the end.
Carbonation is rather low, but stays in perfect balance with the complex body of the beer, due to the malts in it. All in all, this is a great beer.

Fantastic, slight reddish color medium carbonation. 75cl bottle. Really nice funk, sour, horse blanket. Lemon sourness and great wierd musty malt. Slight oak and woody barnwood through the nose when drinking. Just superb on the balance of all these funky flavors. Dry on finish and keeping you wanting more!

Draught Third of a Pint at GBBF 2013, Olympia, London Aug 2013 - Brown in colour. Fruity; sour/lemony/citric/hint of cherries. Tart/acidic/vinegary. Vinous/grapey. Malty. Yeasty. Earthy. Hoppy. Dry. Very refreshing. Liked ths. Lovely lambic!
Pours a murky amber colour. Nice hop bite in the aroma. Strong sour taste.

Birthday beer! One year old. Cloudy deep amber pour with a frothy white head. Dirty pizza shop sourdough funk, nice malt background, citrus, Brett and oak. Tart sourness, lactic acid, citrus, malt background, sharp cheddar, lemon pith and rind with oak smoothness and funky sourdough yeast and sweaty socks. Lively effervescence and medium bodied. Nice!

750ml bottle 6%. Orangey amber colour, fluffy foam beige head that diminishes and aroma of sour yeast, barnyard, citrus rind. Taste is tart lemon rind, grapefruit, woody, yeasty, with light malt & caramel notes and some lingering bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft to medium carbonation, dry sour finish. Complex and tasty, very drinkable.
Overall: Mellow, balanced. Very young.Note: Bottle 750 ml at a De Klomp tasting. (Vintage 2013) Reviewed 2014-01-04.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy orangeish pale amber with a short lived white head. Aroma is tart, brett funk, wild yeast. Flavor is a lot of fruits, wild yeast, flower petals, acetic, white wine. Finish is a boatload of tartness, very powerful, very dry and very refreshing. Lingering tartness and vinegar flavors. Medium to full body, very strong carbonation. Great product.

Bottle at Gainsbar. Darker than usual, small gold head. Aroma is interesting. Quite fruity, lots of sourness. Gaffer tape. Taste is funky, grapefruit at the front, lots of malt too, real body to it. Finish is biscuity. Nice stuff. Lots of drinks this day, so ratings are all over the place.

Sample at First Sunday. Pours hazy orange, with a small, off-white head. The aroma is lemon juice, cardamom and cinnamon, hay, and some barnyard must. Surprisingly mellow sourness, and very sweet and citrusy. Light to medium body, acidic, and a little astringent. Overall, this is an excellent lambic. Balanced, approachable, and delicious. I wish Id gotten a bigger pour.

750ml bottle shared at the brewery. pours a very lively pale yellow with the final glass poured having lots of sediment. aroma is dry wheat and farm yard. taste is again, very lively with lots of yeast, wheat etc. perhaps some pine? very different and perhaps my description is poor but i enjoyed it.

Shared 750 ml bottle. Pours dark bronze with no head at all. Aroma is very tart with notes of yeast and horse blanket. Taste is tart at first but finishes bitter and bonedry. Didn't expect this one to so tart.
Acidic smell, also basement. Orange colour, large head. Very sour. Aroma of yeast, hops, citrus. Very flat carbon, dry.
Bottle - Vintage 2007 - Nice acidic grapes and citrus orange. Cloudy orange with no head. Very acidic white grape, apricot and lemon. Very acidic and not nearly as nice as the others from Cantillon.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2014 Bouteille 750 ml bûe avec Charles au Gainsbourg. 5%. Couleur ambrée, mousse blanche crémeuse. Arôme de grains, houblon floral, acidité. En bouche, notes de vin, douce acidité, floral, houblons discrets mais présents, un peu dagrumes suivi dune finale acide, douce, légèremetn astringente. Excellente.

Vintage 2004
Served to me at delirium cafe, brussels. 

A: bottle has appeared to be in a place with lots of soil as I can rub the label and it feels like man hands at the end of a day of landscaping - rough and granular. The beer pours a turbid and hazy honey color. Having been poured with vigor, bubbles appeared at the surface, but transiently. No lacing. 

S: tart lemons come thru with some interesting earthy and bell pepper tones. Some cider vinegar and also some anise seed at the tippy tip of the tail. 

T: zinga! Sour beer! This is so sour it burns the roof of my mouth, gangster. Flavors of sweaty leather, lemons, potting soil, sheet grass. 

M: thin and dry, nearly no carb left here. As mentioned, top of mouth was burning and at the end, my tongue was quite raw. 

O: although this may be the sourest beer Ive had, which is awesome, I dont think this beer was particularly great for cantillon. Although still very good, and I would drink again and again.

Serving type: bottle

06-22-2011

750ml bottle, shared. 2012 cork. Hazy darker orange red color. Good, thin off-white head. Couple loose splotches of lace. Bigger body. Smooth, soft, lightly slick texture. Lighter carbonation, good big tart sour taste, kind of lemony, floral, citrusy tart funky aroma. Very tasty, enjoyable tart sour lambic. I love it. Very nice, tasty.

bottle shared by albatross, thanks bro. pours hazy and bright golden orange with a creamy off-white head, good retention and lacing. barn, grassy, floral, bitter herbs, dusty, white wine vinous character, particularly juicy and fruity - miscellaneous citrus along with its mild sweetness and obvious tartness. nice acidic profile - lactic/citric/acetic. lively carbonation, light body, drying herbal-grassy and slightly astringent finish. awesome!

Ennesimo high score per Cantillon. Assolutamente uno dei lambic più complessi ed eccentrici in circolazione, e anche uno dei più buoni. Acidità spettacolare e ampia, che abbraccia ogni angolo del palato, arricchita dal sapore erbaceo dei luppoli freschi. Il tutto bilanciato da un amaro leggero ma distinto. Merita una standing ovation!

Bottled on 2012. Pale orange colour with an off white head with medium lasting. Aroma has notes of fruits. Flavor has hints of wood, fruits, good sourness with a decent acidic mouthfeel, fruity and flowery hints. The final has a decent sourness with good duration.

75cl bottle, from Geers. Bottled in 2011 says the cork. Pours amber, beige head. Malty nose, no hops. Aroma is acid sourness with a pale ale malt backbone, had no luch in finding the hops. Way to sour for me.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2015 2011 bottle. Pours a beautiful orange unclear beer with a good white head. Smells sour, fruity. Tastes heavy sour and a lots more. Not the usual geuze taste. Thin body, watery texture and an average carbo.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Färsk på bryggeriet. Pigg humle i doften och låg i funk, vilket var lite otippat för mig. Gyllene och klar. Frisk och härlig. Grapefruktjuice. En klantig turist välter ut ett av glasen och skäms en aning.   ---  

Flaska på Mikkeller bar 2003. Har det hänt något på 10 år? Känns inte så. Funk, belgiskt stall och lite ättika. Möjligen lite bättre och balanserad. Möjligen. Låg beska.
Notes from backlog. Less than I was expecting. Still a nice acidity, but lacking in overall feeling. Some nice floral notes however.

Pours a hazy golden pinkish brown from the bottle with dissipating bubbly off-white head. Aroma is sour fruits and funky yeast, slight woody ending. Taste is tropical fruit, sour middle, funky grapes, hay and grass, then a lingering sour. Bubbly effervescence covers a little of the sour. Wow, awesome.

75cl bottle, green glass makred simply as I in the brewery. Quite deep colour, bright brown amber with a hint of copper. Deep flavour, slightly more robust malty background given the predominance of barley. Hops add a lovely extra layer of complexity, some fruit maybe grapefruit and (as if needed) some woody character, spruce and pine. And of course a deep sourness, long prickly finish. Splendid.

Pours clear deep blond, two finger white head.

Smell bitter and bretty.

Taste tart, bretty aftertaste. Hop presence is felt. Bit of fruit and a bit of bile

Lighter body, bit thicker than regular lambic

Interesting, experimental, decent
Cloudy gold pour, big funk nose. Flowers upfront move to light tart. Body is slick and smooth.

floral and acidic aroma, light golden, hazy, big white foam; quite high sourness, lightly sweet, after a while also moderate bitterness; light body, thin feel, crisp, rather lively carbonation, long sour and bitter finish;
Overall: GREAT beer, refreshing, highly drinkable and just incredible tasty
Cloudy amber color with white head. Nice floral aroma, also herbal. At taste is sour and bitter.

Bernstein, leuchtend, fruchtig sauer im aroma, sauer im geschmack, bitter, trocken im abgang

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 11, 2016 Tap at Akkurat. Hazy gold - amber beer. Little white head. Palate is crisp and light and dry. Typical gueuze sourness - medium strength. Woody dried fruits. Splash of white wine and light peppermint. Fairly light finish, touch floral. Not bad.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2016 Old rating rerated 20.10 2013, 0,75l bottle (bottled 28.01.2013) @ home:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh and funky, citrus peel, hay, sour socks, brett, old hops, lemon, oak, grass. Taste is surprisingly mild, kind of sour-ish dry, citrus peel, hay, hops, citrus, brett, soda powder, grass, oak. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Poured from bottle with my wife to celebrate our second little one, pours hazy with a thin head and light lacing in the glass, the aroma has a decent amount of fruit and funk mixed in with hay and grass at the same time, interesting, the flavor has a slight sour front end with some of the hop notes coming through in the finish, not overly tart but still really nice. Enjoyable.

How: Bottle.
Where: Shared at SBWF 2013.-
Appearance: Hazy orange colour with a small white head.
Aroma: Sour, fruit, tart.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Acidic, sour, tart, fruit.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2014 Bottle: Bruised tangerine color, completely opaque and full of haze with a tiny, beige head that piles up quickly and dissipates just as fast. Aroma is full of signature Cantillon critters; sweaty barnyard funk, mild horsey notes, and a bludgeoning of wet hay. Soft wheat, grassy & floral hops (different for a lambic), and an onset of tart lemons, white wine & vinous oak, and a little bit of vinegar and acidity on the back. Taste is very tart up front, complete with sour apples, lemons, lactic acid, & faint white wine vinegar. Plenty of funky, barnyard floor and sweaty horse flavors keeping good balance. Nice woodiness throughout; birch-like & grassy with a more vinous, oak-aged finish. Bone dry. Another great beer from this great brewery.
Vintage 2005. Amber colour, minimal head. Soft cabonation. Very well balanced beer. Not as tart as the other Cantillons. Taste is sour with a bitter hoppy finish. Very good!

2013 vintage. Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. I kept it in my cellar for a few weeks. At first I planned to keep it there a couple of years but I changed my mind. Absolutely loved it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled: 12/2011
A: Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

S: Funky, Hay, Grassy, Tart Apples

T: Tart Apples, Funk, Yeasty

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Bitter

Overall, a nice unblended gueze but definitely a step behind in flavor from the classic gueze

2011 vintage, 75cl bottle shared. Wonderfully mature, sedated barley version of the else balsamic regular Cantillon: lemon rind bitter, succinctly tart instead of sour, delicate aromas of fresh and old hops - love this is lambic.

From 9/29 notes. Shared with John for Breaking Bad finale tasting, beer #1. 750ml bottle (Jan 13) pours hazy toasted brown into tulip with 1 figer head. Nose is oak barrel, mild tart, earthy, grapes, funk, musty. Mouthfeel is tart medium carbonation, smooth, with a touch of creaminess. Taste is bready, sourdough, oats, vinegarette, big woody oak tones, cider, nice funk, restrained underlying sourness throughout, complex. Finish is crisp tartness, funky barrel notes, bready. What else can you expect from Cantillon, its superb.

2007 vintage courtesy of sweemzander. Lots of nice black mold around the cap and cork. 750 ml bottle served in a mini snifter. 

A: Pours a hazy straw color with a white head forming on the pour. It recedes to a thin ring that leaves some sticky lace around the glass.

S: Really sweet smelling with a mix of flowery hops and light acidity. Very surprised at how hoppy it still is after 6 years. Slightly sweet mix of wheat and malt with a lactic lemon like quality to it.

T: Same as the nose with a little more barrel character. The smell of flowery hops is distinct and it has a fruity sweetness to it. Slightly lactic lemon character with some oak barrel and a mild hint of vanilla.

M: Light and airy with a spritzy carbonation. Smooth and lactic on the backend with a slight drying quality.

O: Not overtly sour and still very hoppy. This was an interesting take on a lambic and I really enjoyed it. Id like to revisit some later and early vintages to have a comparison since my first experience is with this beer being 6 years old.

Serving type: bottle

05-23-2013

Bottle from the bayou. They had to go into the back to bet this one. This makes style number 74. Pours golden with a thin khaki head. Massive funky bubble gum on the nose. Insanely tart and crisp on the tongue. Finish lingers and lingers and lingers which considering what this beer costs and how long Ive waited to house it it should linger for several months. Worth the wait!

Pours hazy orange amber with thick, tall yellowish white head. Aroma of green grapes, bretta, nectarine, slightly earthy, hints of apples. Taste is big apple sour with tart and almost overripe fruit. Finish is slightly funky tart sour. Body is light and crisp with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer was good but it sure didnt blow me away like I thought a cantillon would. Shared this with Mike. I was hoping for a real sour experience. Sharp nose. Very cloudy and hazy pour with white head and nice lacing. Sweet and sour aroma. Lots of earth and funk with some berries and apple. There are some bitter herb and spice notes. Mild sourness with a bitter finish. Floral earthy, herb flavor, drying celery finish. Very unique. Would have liked a bit more sourness, but overall very good.

Appearance: very hazy amber color, poured with a small beige head

Aroma: sour, wine like, grape

Taste: hints of wine taste, bitter, sour, tart, grapes

Palate: leaves a sour aftertaste, leaves mouth very dry, average c02,

Overall: poured from a bottle, I like this better than the zwanze edition but they are related, kind of wine like

Im all for sour stuff, but this just didnt do it for me. Pours murky, milky light brown. Plenty of head. Aroma is sour - lactic acid, sour grapes/apple. And, to put it simply, dirt. And some skunk. Bitterness throughout. Aromas were flat and deadened, and the sourness and bitterness was too aggressive by half. Maybe a bad bottle, but I wont be shelling out (a lot) for another any time soon.
Darkish cloudy orange with a small pale head. Aroma is citrus zest, apricot, peach. Tart on the palate with a good balance of sweet and sour. Taste is sour peach candy, apricot, lemon zest. Nice

2012 bottle.
Aroma has a nice phenolic note to it with hints of fruity acidity. Medium barnyard funkiness and some light oak notes. Hint of a floral character. 
Pours a clear amber orange with a small white head that shows average retention then recedes to the edges. 
Flavor has a faint sweetness upfront but that quickly recedes. Moderate barnyard funkiness with some light oak notes. Some fruity acidity with some juicy citrus and light cherry character. Light tropical fruit. Dry finish with a faint herbal character and some lingering funk.
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Soft character to the carbonation. Low but present acidic astringency and low alcohol warmth.
Overall a very enjoyable beer and a nice departure from the wheat based lambics. The barley adds a nice darker malt character to it making for a more phenolic beer.

Appearance: slight white head when poured, this was poured from a bottle, cloudy orange color 
Aroma: sour but has a tinge of sweetness, floral, berry 
Taste: sour at the end, it has a slight sweet taste, slight berry flavor, it has a nice sour flavor at the end
Palette:Dryness left on tongue, bitter
Overall: this is a great sour! I also had the iris swanze edition and this is much better 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2014 Zwanze day 2013. 2004 vintage. Pours orange. Aroma is fig hay dirt raison tart. Taste is barrel tart fig. Finish is medium okay. Mouthfeel is medium. Not amazing. 3. (I us no freaking clue why I rated this so low he fest time????)

At bier circus with Taylor. Vintage 2002; 2004 cork date. Aroma is delicate, floral-earthy, pretty funky, hint of mustiness. Taste is complex earthy, low acidity, hint if white wine notes, dry, mouth watering. Fantastic Lambic. 4.2.
75cl bottle @ home, from Geers Oostakker; orange coloured with medium head; decent carbo; nose is acid, wood; taste is dry, wood, tart, dry aftertaste as well, oily palate. Decent.

750ml bottle. Clear amber colour with average, thick, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Spicy and floral yeasty aroma, hoppy overtones with a touch of hay, fruity notes of grapes. Taste is tart, tannic, slightly bitter, notes of hay, a floral touch, cautious hints of nutmeg.

750ml bottle shared at home. Pours hazy light amber, with small white head. Unusual aromas, in the the sourness is clearly there, represented as cider-like smells, but with lots of floral notes and grass. Vinous qualities when drunk, which is surprising for the strength, sweet and sour on the taste, not much bitterness though. Very nice.

Draft at the Great British Beer Festival 2013.
Poured a hazy light brown/ golden colour. Aroma of tart lemon, white wine vinegar and straw. Sour vinegar flavours grab the tastebuds, with grain, vegetable and unripe flavours. Theres a bit of a burst of hop then a nicely balanced sweet/ sour ending.

750 ml bottle shared at the pre-Natifest gathering. Pours a hazy amber color with a small whitish head. The aroma and flavor have funk, herbal notes, vinegar, some fruity character, floral and acidic. The flavor has a sharp acidity as well as ample floral character. I get some mild vinous notes toward the finish. Solid.

Bottle at Novare Res. Opaque light amber pour with an off white head. Floral aromas. Sour but somewhat sweet with caramel notes. Tart floral characteristics with a hoppy bitterness in the finish. Dry with good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle - thanks Brian! Pours hazy amber with a small beige head and decent lacing. Immediate surprise since I thought unblended lambics were supposed to be uncarbonated. Aroma is funk, lemon, barnhard, herbal. Flavor is the same, little sweetness, some fruitiness, light funk, light tart and some bitterness as well. Surprisingly muted and balanced, again since it is unblended and since most Cantillons I have sampled are not really muted in their funkiness. Medium body, champagnelike carbonation. A nice experience.
Bottle. Pours hazy copper with a frothy white head. Aroma is barnyard, funk, earthy, bread and hay. Taste is sour, light sweet. Medium body and fizzy carbonation.
Bottle at Mikkeller Bar. Rich reddish orange pour with a white head. Nice sweet tart nose with a bit of funk. A bit puckering on the tongue. Tart light fruit. Crisp. Fantastic!

tasted at Bottle share with Derick and Erin...THANKS! Small snifter. Pours a dark golden amber with thin white foamy head. Head didnt last and not much lacing. The aroma was superb with fruit, bread, brett, and wood. Not much of an acidic smell. Taste was even better with fruits, wood, earth, slight funk and moderate tartness. Extremely well blended and the hops character was nice compared to most sours. Oh wow it is a good beer. Medium to light in body. Moderate carbonation.
Extremely sour, sending tinges of acidity to the back of my jaw, lots of lemon peel, buttery on my teeth and tongue, with a rich ripe semi dry finish. Lots of cloying sour notes. awesome. awesome.

Cask gravity at GBBF 2013. Touch cloudy, chestnut brown. No head. Tart sour, sour grainy, malty, brown malt vinegar aroma. Taste is malty, tart sour, brown malt vinegar, brown sugar, slight mustiness. Not my favourite lambic.

Cask at gbbf 2013. Onion skin colour hazed with small white head. Aroma is light vinegar and farm slight chive. Flavour is funk light tart some old cheesey hop. Nice and complex. Low carb. Medium body. Medium tart duration.
Hazy copper with no head. Aroma of wheat and white grapes, very pungent. Taste of dry white wine, grain, funk... About a dozen things I cant even name. Fantastic.

On tap at the mikeller opening. A - pours hazy dark amber orange. With 1 finger fluffy head. S - wet wool sock, moldy cheese funk, quiet lemon, brown sugar, egg, musty oak. Tart cherries and urinal cakes. So musty. M - light tart body with soft carb. Watery feel. Thicker end, lingering quiet tartness. T - green soft wet clovers, quiet musty and and overripe sweet lemon juice, horse blanket and Brett like earthiness. Lingering sticky sweetness. O - musty like mad in the smell but the taste is quite good. 3.9

Pours a nice rich orange color with fluffy white head. Aromas of juicy citrus, Sauvignon Blanc, spicy hops, oak, and mild funk. The palate is hoppy, spicy, and bitter, with flavors of fresh citrus, oak, white grapes, and sour. I can drink this all day. Finshes crisp, clean, acidic, and dry. I have always liked this Cantillon more than others, and I think its one of the best "easy to get" Cantillons.

Nalty hay, barnyard. Tart apple. Oraange zest, sour peaches. Acidic palate. Fruity sharp sour flavours, vinegarish notes. Not too extreme, but very much raw tasting lambic.-- bb/wp8

750 mL bottle in trade from Quebec. Poured into tulip glass. Reddish brown color. Moderate head. Smell of lambic sour. Taste is complex and rich as it warms and swims around your mouth. try with some sharp white cheddar.
750ml->stem. Hazy orange/gold with effervescent small white head. Aroma and taste are tart, funky yeast and cherries. Excellent.
Bottle..Big thanks to mora2000.Pour is golden with a white head..Nose is funk, barrel,cheese, dry,floral, mint..Taste is spice, floral, mint, funk, dry, oily, cheese..wow

Funky sour with tart cherry and some slight lemon. Has a burnt orange color. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
75cl bottle. Orange to copper color. Thin to medium white head. Carbonation is soft. Taste is all! Sour, bitter, sweet, nicely acid. Aroma is hop, fruit, herbs and floral.
Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Massive sourness, tartness, fruits and berries.

2012 bottle. Pours a hazy amber orange with off white head that quickly settles, great lacing. Smell is lots of funk, lemon, hops, hint of vanilla. Taste is a nice balance of citric tartness/lemon and funk on a background of dry hop and bittering hops which definitely lingers in the finish. The hops also add a pleasant spiciness to the beer which adds to the complexity. Not overly acidic which is a good thing. Another great one from Cantillon.
UPDATED: MAR 13, 2014 Lys gyllen farve med lyst skum som ligger. Lukt av blomster og humle. Smak av masse sitrusfrukter og god humle. Søt, sur, tøtt og masse bitterhet. Cardinal.
Frisk lukt av frukter. Tynt skum. Gyllen farge. Tørt smak sittende som tørr hvitvin.

Bottle in Brussels. Pours cloudy orange with a short, off white head. Nose is lemon peel, white wine, champagne, hops and of course funky barnyard aromas. Taste is zesty sourness, lemon peel tartness and a nice green apple sweetness. Very well balanced, pleasure to drink.

Original review 10-02-09. 2007 Vintage into Duvel tulip.

Pours a hazy/mirky copper orange with a fizzy off-white head. A decently aggressive pour yields about 2 fingers-worth of head. Some decent head retention leave a thin layer of head fizzy here and there. Lots of funky, tart, and sour notes smacks you across the face right away. Barnyard, horse blanket, and some tart citrus notes as well but this is pretty much funk funky funkness. Not quite as funky as the nose. Has tart orange-peel notes that stick out a lot and make the finish bitter. I dont know if Im really digging that characteristic but it doesnt totally ruin this lambic. Citrus, tart/sour, some acidic notes in there as well. Light and fizzy, just how I like em. Very champagne-esk dry finish.

2013. Blonde foncé. Sédimenteuse. Nez: Terre. Feuille morte. Floral. Bois trempe. Bouche: Très acide. Terreuse. Floral. Levuré. Citron amère. Levure sauvage. Poussiéreuse. Pas ma préféré de Cantillon.

Bottle. Pours cloudy amber to orange with nice and surprisingly rich (for lambi) tan head. Aroma is malt, dry hops, lambic basement with some fruity tones. Flavor is sour and slightly bitter, with malt and hops showing through.

Bottled 0,75L - aged 2003. Fraught dark blond color, mighty bubbly aspect with a creamy and foamy head of long duration. Much sour and winous taste, citrus and orange peel smell, alcohol, fruit from a citrus tree, yeast. Powerfull lively and crisp body, discreet alcoholic perception, winous and cellar mouth, very tart taste with a final sweetish notes on the end.

26th June 2013Craft Clerkenwell Tasting. Hazy gold - amber beer. Little white head. Palate is crisp and light and dry. Typical gueuze sourness - medium strength. Woody dried fruits. Splash of white wine. Fairly light finish, touch floral. Not bad.
Pours a deep orange gold with no head. Aroma of funk, oak and slight citrus. Taste is earthy, funk, oak and sour wheat. So tasty and just plain amazing. I love this beer!

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2013 Bouteille 750ml, embouteillée le 28 janvier 2013. Couleur ambrée foncée trouble, mousse beige évanescente. Arôme de brett, boisé, vineux léger, terreux, houblon très léger, pommes très mûres. Goût de brett, bonne acidité, champignons, boisé, légère amertume, pomme verte, terreux en arrière-goût. Carbonation moyenne, corps moyen-dense.

Deep orange color. Aroma: Bread, grass, citrus, herbs, peach, apple, hops, cheese and vinegar. So funky! Taste: Very sour! Apples, citrus, lemon, hops and vinegar. Lively carbonation. The flavours culminate into a dry, slightly bitter, finish. Overall a very complex beer, a lot of stuff I couldnt really find words for. Im not used to lambics or sours yet, but I can see why its worth investigating. Thought it might be a good gateway beer because of its fresh hops, but to be honest its probably the most complex lambic Ive tried so far.

thanks to zenkis 
Hazy light amber with huge beige head, decent duration.
Aroma.. fruity, apricots, hops, acid
Sour, decent bitter for this kinda beer, bit sweetish. 
Uhh.. I am not a fan of sour ales, but if I drink one, I would like it more intense. This one definitely isnt bad. quite complex, thou it lacks intensity, character
Aroma of great bandaid and barnyard funk. Slight peach. Pours bright orange with slight film and fizzy. Taste is great with peach pit, oak, and sl8ght cellar funk. Pure and perfect.

On tap @ Ölrepubliken Gothenburg. Nice to see it on tap! Pours hazy, orange to red. Floral, grassy, earthy, fruity. Got som sweetness upfront but finish nice and sour. You just gotta love this stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drack från fat på ölrepubliken. Orangeröd med lätt, blek skumkrona. Lukten lämnade mig oförstående, men smaken sade allt. Vid första träffen på tungan fanns en viss sötma, som direkt byttes mot sura bär och citrus. Annorlunda men häftig öl, med hjälp av denna och en fin stout kan vem som helst förstå hur olika öl kan vara.

Bottle, 2003 version. Hazy orange with at medium sized off white head. Horse, white grapes, sour berries, light floral and green hops, wood. Taste starts light sweet but quickly turns sour with some light bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Very refreshing and drinkable.

Pours slight reddish amber. Frogged and sticky when poured. Nice white head. Smell is sour and grassy. Some gooseberry and stuff, and some medicine in the late end. Low carb, but nice body. Tee why MotherBrother.

Bottle, corked and capped.. Pours a lovely slightly hazed darker orange beer with a nice, off white head on top. There is definitely Brett in the aroma, with a nice, malty and hoppy presence. Also, some barnyard funkyness is there. Not that much fruit detected. Flavour is not what I expected. Reading the description here, explains why. There is a big hop presence in the beer alongside a dry tartness. Its very smooth to drink, yet very complex. Very dry, woody finish that dries my entire mouth. Flavours of green apples and spicey notes makes this very nice to drink..

2012 Bottle. Nose is lactose, grapefruit,some vinegar. Lots of horse blanket as it warmed. Taste, was a classic lambic base, with sour apple, some oak,  very vinegary notes, cellar. The dry hopping led to grapefruit, and a deeply bitter resin finish.

Magnificent beer, the dry hopping working in harmoniously with the lambic.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2013 2012 vintage. Pour from a 750ml bottle at Proletariat.  Pours beautiful golden apricot with a thick, foamy, fluffy white head. Aroma is lots of tart lemons, barnyard funk, a bit of sweet fruit, vinegar and some floral notes. Taste is bright, tart and acidic with a perfect balance between tart fruit, vinegar, lots of woodiness/oakiness and traditional lambic funkiness. Theres a lingering tartness on the palate and a dry, tart, champagne-like finish. Really lovely stuff.

Bouteille 750 ml. Servie dans une flûte. Ça mest apparu digne dun 500e rating, dautant plus que je navais pas encore bu de lambic unblended. Robe orange trouble. Au nez, un bouquet rustique, dominé par les levures sauvages, les barriques de vin, les fruits acides (pommes vertes), une touche boisée et un soupson de houblon. Le goût est essentiellement dominé par lacidité des pommes vertes.  Un peu mince en bouche. Rafraîchissante et légère.
Share with Bish and Danny at Craven Arms. One half of Bros was standing behind us, he hadnt aged a bit, still looked like a teenager. It probably wasnt him.
Shared with the delicious Domnik and delectable Danyul. A great start to a great night. Got the attention of the people sitting by me at the bar. That is the end of my story.
My least favorite Cantillon. Still a good beer like everything else Jean makes. However not my thing.
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2014 Flaska från Doorstep Brew. Gyllene bärnstensfärgad vätska. Tydliga inslag av jäst. Wow, smaken innehåller ett gäng citroner. Lång eftersmak.

A huge lemony aroma with some grassy notes underneath it. Tight and tart, with plenty of dryness to it. Puffy and smooth. Some bitterness too I guess. SO TART. Wonderfully done, I cant really pull too much of the character of the green hops they use but its still killer.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow, with a big airy head. Aroma is vinegar, oak and brett, as well as notes of grain. Quite full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is, of course, sour, with oak and balsamic vinegar, as well as some roasted notes of grain and bread.

Bottle: vintage 2012:
Just wanted to taste a fresh Cantillon with this warm weather.
A medium to smaller sized and quickly changing (into a lacing) creamy foamy head with a very light pink touch to it.
The beer has a hazy amber orange color.
Aroma of wild yeast, cellar, hops, stone, flowers, soap, dust, wood, something light bit warm wood fruity ish and brown sugars with a sprinkle of something caramel ish.
Flavours of malts, flowers, bitter, wood, yeast, cellar, dusty, light dry, fruity, stone, light herbal, light floral, light sour (for Cantillon beers this is very light sour)! Overall fruity, yeasty and malty.
Aftertaste is malty, bitter, yeast, woody and fruity.
Low carbo, soft creamy siljy ish mouthfeel, medium to lightly fuller body and a creamy texture.
A very fine, tasty and pretty balanced beer. One of the few negative things I can day about it is that the bitterness has a light tendency to go towards the nasty...
Overall very enjoyable and an easy Cantillon beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: (75 cl bottle from Vinens Verden; 2003 vintage bottled 2005) Pours a beautiful, semi-clear amber with medium, slightly tan head that is relatively dense and shows some retention but not much regeneration. Aroma is lambic cideriness with subtle notes of dried flowers and urinal. Oily texture and practically flat with a tart finish. Flavour has a nicely bitter twist about halfway, which takes the mind off the dry tartness. Quite pleasant and drinkable.

2011 bottle. The Iris has an inviting amber color and is nicely carbonated, leaving a very fine foam in my glass. The aroma is pleasantly floral, a touch of funkiness, and light fruit scents. The flavor is acidic but tends to lose its intensity and I was left with a good dryness in its place. When the funky flavor takes off I noticed lite hops, yeast, grains, and citra fruits. The finish is of weak vinegar, a mild dryness, and fuity flavors. Overall this was a fine beverage.

Pours cloudy orange with a small beige head. Smells sour and floral. Taste is sour, bitter, and floral. Medium-bodied with an astringent texture and lightly prickly mouth-carbonation, Cantillon Iris finishes with a soft lingering bitterness.

75cl bottle, served in Cantillon glass (Tumbler). Pours golden with small white lasting froth. Aroma is citrus blended with fruits and the usual sour touch (moderate intensity). The flavor is lemon, green apples, and hints of caramel. White grape notes as well, some bitterness in the palate. Medium body, soft carbonation. Pretty tasty, like this more than the classic one.

Bottle at Craven Arms, Birmingham (and a right bargain it was too). Awesomely full of flavour. Intense sourness, but not as sour as some other err sours Ive had. This has a real richness to it, with some spiciness entwixted within to it. Smooth, think in the teeth/airbreathing chamber. Smoothly well balanced, with a variety of interesting flavour notes which I cant be bothered to tell you about. Immense. Leicester lost while I was drinking this but I didnt notice. Split with my chum Gurd, who after years of my tutelage has finally morphed into a full time beer geek - he specifically requested some lambic (hence why we bought this) - I was so proud I could of cried. Then he took a photograph of it and awarded it 5 our of 5 stars, using his smart phone. Amazing isnt it these days - you know, the old technology field. Melons.
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2013 Very sour, with lots of floral citrusy acidic tones, slight vinegar along with cheese and funk, not the best cantillon out there but still a pleasure.

375ml bottle from 2004. Ruby and amber colour with a minimal rose head. Cant get over how acedic and dry this is along with some pleasant light fruit. Mild carbonation, full body, bitter, vinegar, long finish but it keeps on going. It does however stip the enamel off your teeth.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 75cl bottle. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: dark amber, off white small head.
Nose: dry grass, hay, barnyard.
Taste: bitter, dry, oranges, vinous, hops

Pours a orange copper color with a two finger eggshell foam. Aromas are tart lemon, dry funk, apricot, mild floral sweetness... The palate follows the nose with a heightened complexity. Ripe underlying stonefruit, musk, cider vinegar and orchid funk. Long smooth finish with tight acidity peaking through.
Bottle, pours bright golden, nice head, aroma of funk, flavour was lots of souriness and it was very tasty, thanks for the share
2012 bottle. Earthy and herbal aroma. IT is a dry and effervescent beer with a strong lemony tartness and a medium to low funk level.

Tasted from the bottle, on 13/03/2013.
Pours muddy copper with a tiny head.
Aroma is intense, lovely bretty bready, horsy and sweaty.
Taste is extremely acidic, even with no wheat at all. Then lovely piny, tropical fruits, grass, flowers - quite complex.
Recommended.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tasted at BBF. Orange colour with almost no head. Fruity aromas (cherry, maybe apples), acid and fruity taste, not very sweet.

Grifo. Vaso de ½ pt. Saboreada en mar´13. Color ámbar y apariencia turbia. Espuma amarillenta que deja una fina capa en la superficie. Aromas de levadura, ácido cítrico y pan fresco con matices florales. El sabor de malteado moderadamente tostado y pan queda desbordado por un ascendente toque tartárico. Cuerpo ligero pero paladar voluptuoso. Carbonatación moderada. Lúpulos moderados en el intermedio. Final agridulce y prolongado. Notas de pomelo en el retrogusto. Deliciosa y refrescante.
On-tap. 1/2pt glass. Enjoyed on mar´13. Amber color & foggy appearance. Yellowish froth leaves a thin layer on top. Yeast, citric/acidic & fresh bread aromas. Floral hues. Mild toasted malting & bread at first sip is overwhelmed by increasing tartaric touch. Light body but voluptuous palate. Moderate carbonation. Moderate hops in the middle. Long sweet/acidic finish. Grapefruit notes on the aftertaste. Delightful & refreshing.

Thanks again for sending this Pandableh. What a cool treat. Nose is lemon, funk, floral and a touch of earthiness to it. Fruity and acidic. Pour is burn orange with a white head. Overall, this wasnt overly tart, but just the right amount to make it enjoyable. Funky notes mixed with citrus and floral notes to make this one a winner. One of my favorite Cantillons to date.

Thanks OmegaX, for the share. The pour was a cloudy yellow with somewhat of a head. Aromas were of honeysuckle, sour candies and grapefruit. The taste followed but the carbonation gave way to hints of lemongrass, fresh hops and dried lemons. This brew is delicate and one to be savored for sure, as Im sure Ill never see a bottle ever again.

750 ml. corked n capped bottle- Poured very carefully creates a hazy orange  one and a half finger white head that reduces. Aroma is very barnyard and tart, funky for sure. The taste is wow, mouth puckering goodness, tart as hell, acidic, trying to detect the hops, being they are more prominent in this beer, possibly there, but not in your face, more imparting a dryness in the finish. This beer is just well made, very good.

From log; funky smell and not too sour.
Good beer and it is fairly easy to drink.
Vintage 2003. Nice fruity sour flavor with I grapelike aftertaste. Amber in color with a white head.

Amazing beer..
Amber color, with a nice head.
Sour aromas and taste, with a bit more bitter aftertaste. Not like a Gueuze but still sour and refreshing.

750 ml corked and capped green bottle; bottled on May 5, 2012; almost 9 months old. After almost three and a half years on this site, an unblended lambic finally comes my way. This is the last style on this website that I have yet to rate, all other styles long since found and rated. Im not a trader, so this shit is hard to come by, especially here in North Idaho. I have Russell Mann at Enoteca to thank for this. I placed my order for this about two years or so ago and it took him awhile to get it, but he followed through. Pours murky orange with a large cream-colored head with good retention. Aroma is wonderful in its funkiness, classic lambic barnyard with lemon, floral, earth, SweeTarts--nice and pungent, although my favorite American sours are a bit more up my alley. Taste is nice, sour and acidic, but not quite as mouth-puckering as La Folie or Avery Odio Equum; finishes dry and a little bitter. To my surprise, its not flat. Ive always heard unblended lambics were lacking in carbonation, but this isnt; its actually moderate. Really good, but I prefer Cantillons Gueuze. Definitely a worthwhile beer seeking out, even if it takes awhile to find its way into your hands.

Thank you to my friend Tobey for bringing this fine souvenir from Copenhagen. Vintage 2011, 750 ML, poured into Three Floyds Teku glasses to split with my wife. 

The aroma is classic Cantillon. Enticingly sweet and remarkably sour in the nose. Barnyard and fresh cut, wet hay meld with green apple, honey, and lemon zest. 

Color and appearance are both notable given the beers amber hue, which is a clear contrast to the usual golden straw of Gueuze or Cuvée St. Gilloise. Clarity is nearly perfect, and the beautiful pure white ring of carbonation provides another fine contrast in appearance. 

First sip at 45 degrees is full on sour. Sour apple, white grape, citric acid dominate. As the beer warms past 55 degrees, lightly floral notes become present in the finish, likely a function of the growingoy present hopping. The tartness begins to linger in full funk as I continue sipping. This isnt as pleasant as Cuvée St. Gilloise, but its close. 

The lambic has a greter body than most of its siblings, which I enjoy immensely. The lingering funk and tannins keep the taste buds at attention. Also interesting is a lactose-like creaminess that lingers on the back of the tongue. Definitely unique in Cantillons already impressive oeuvre  

Overall, Iris is not my favorite from this brewery. However, it is enjoyable, delicious, and is worth seeking out again. Id love to try it weeks old as well as perhaps 5-10 years old to taste the evolution of the hop presence.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy amber with plentiful but airy off-white head. intense vinous aroma with gentle, sweetish malty notes. Extremely dry onset followed by a vinous flavour, edning dry with discrete notes of cardboard. My first pure Lambic. A good experience. :-)
375 ml bottle, vintage 2005. Aroma tangy with notes of malt and citrus. Flavor is good balanced between sweetness and acidity. Citrus is one of the flavor notes present.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2016 Color arancio lievemente torbido con un fragile velo di schiuma bianca. Al naso è aspra con sentori di fieno, limone, legno verde e profumi floreali; gusto acidulo, meno acetica di altri lambic, quasi fruttato allinizio e amarognola verso il finale dove si avvertono i luppoli, retrogusto secco e asciutto. Dissetante, effervescente e ben strutturata, un altro centro pieno di Cantillon. Eccezionale.

Aroma has lots of brett, funky, yeast notes - a touch sweet, not much else. Appearance is golden dark orange colour with nice off-white, lambic-typical, large-bubbled head. Taste is nice brett, funky tastes, honey, touch malty and sour, evolves to a slight earthy taste, spicey too. Palate is super sour, complements the effervescent bitterness. Overall pretty great - may just lack a touch of complexity and character in the taste, but not at all in the palate.
On tap at Meridian Pint, DC.  Pours a cloudy amber with an off white head.  Sour apple nose.  Lovely tart citrus with a crisp lingering tart finish.
bottle. pours gold with medium white head. has a unique floral and zesty nose of hops and earthy grass. taste is hop and lemon rind slight funky crisp taste

2004 bottle shared @ Spuyten Duyvil for Zwanze Day 2012.  Pours a brickish orange color with a puffy white head that quickly settles.  The aroma is fuller than most other Cantillons, with the hop character balancing out some of the typical funk and some clear contribution from the malts in a form of almost like toasted rye bread.  On the palate, the tartness dominates, but the mouthfeel is rich and there is a crisp zing from the hops.  Cool beer.

this is such a great idea, been wanting to try this for awhile and had some at Zwanze at the Holy Grale. interesting nose, some funk some slight sour, then there is an aroma i cant fully put a finger on but im sure its the hops. the look of a cloudy tan with a white head. the taste was that good ol cantillon sour but it definitely changed with the hopping schedule and the change of grains. there are hints of lemon zest, citrus, slight pine. this has a slight chew to it, the body feels nice solid with lots of lively carbonation. overall this was awesome and i will pick it up or get a glass any chance i can. awesome old world take on new world ideas.
Lemon rind candied. Thereis a musty white wine sort of aroma  maybe some pepper. Pretty gold Orange. No head hazy as all hello. Sour rind drives the flavor flavor.

750 ml bottle (shared with the Mrs.) to oversized snifter. Looks solid; an opaque brownish-orange with off-white head that dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes tart, hoppy, and funky with a good mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

75cl bottle,2009 from Beers Of Europe
Light amber colour with a small white head.
Lambic nose,old hops and barnyard aromas.
Sour lemon and green grape taste but also wood and some fruitiness.Very dry finish at the end.Very tasty and interesting beer,as always from Cantillon.

E stato un innamoramento immediato, color ambra, testa minimale, delizionso aroma di luppoli freschi, pompelmo, fieno. in bocca è delicata, non invade, ma cresce ad ogni sorso, lacidità è moderata, ancora agrumi, mela verde. corpo medio, carbonazione fine

750ml bottle. Tart, grape aromas. Pours hazy amber, vanishing white head, poor lacing, Body is light, high carbonation, crispy texture. Bitter taste, aged, some hints of wood, resin, wine flavours. Aftertaste is dry, astrigent and lately some sweet. Enjoyable, not balanced (no one expected this to be so) and maybe a peculiar Cantillon among its portfolio. Nice.

Cloudy amber body with a white head. Nice sour aroma with grapes, green apple, tea, grass, lemon. Medium, decently carbonated palate. Exceptional sour and floral flavour with lemon, grapes and a really interesting dry bitter finish.
On tap at Akkurat. It poured a hazy golden liquid. Nice acid with lots of elderflower. Very nice.

2007 Vintage. Bottle at home with friends during GABF week. Pour is clear amber with a small off-white head and great lacing. Funky, cobwebs, lemon peel, dusty, light caramel, and floral hops in the aroma. Taste is lemon zest, funk, citric acid, flowers, dust, barnyard, light white wine vinegar, and biscuit with a moderately tart finish. Medium mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Great lambic and so well-balanced, hard to believe that it is unblended.
UPDATED: JUL 17, 2013 amazing beer! its so nice to have it easy to get everywhere! such a good base beer, kind of different with the 100%barley malt in but delish nevertheless!

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2014 This one also deserves a re-rate, now that im more into the style of lambics . Had this one again at cantillon brewery . Only had this twice. Before I was into geuzes, and just now . 

The bottle I drank now was magnificent. Yu can really taste the grains, together with a complex sour , funky touch . All comes very nice in balance together . Lovely beer . Will also try to re-rate as I am sure as hell will have this again in the future !
2012.10.06 - sample at brewery (brouwkwintessens Cantillon) - need to re-rate bottle in basement (reminder) - more bitter than the other cantillon products

Tap at the Cask, Pimlico - 28/09/12.
Hazy orange with a minimal off-white head that quickly clears to the edge.
Sour fruits, apples, pears on the nose, wood and burnt tones.
Tastes as nose, cork wood tones.
Medium bodied with a little soft carbonation leading to an astringent finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottled Dec 15, 2011. Dark gold verging on amber, white head that fizzles away and leaves no lacing. Nose is fresh barley, hops, rubbing alcohol, and hay. Taste is lemon, grain, fresh water, and herbs. Clean and crisp, noticeable hops. I prefer the funkier blended lambics but this is still excellent.

Lätt grumlig bärnstensfärgad öl med gulorange livligt skum. Doft av omogna äpplen, källare och trä antydan av humle. Träsmakerna påtagliga tillsammas med viss funkighet, lätt vinägersurhet, blommig med en torr munkänsla.

Sampled at Stoutfest. Label says its a 2007 vintage, but the cork says its 2010. I am gonna go with this being a 2007. Pours a hazy orange in color with maybe a quarter fingers worth of tight white head. Nose is exceptionally balanced. There is lemon and a fair amount of floral character to it. It resembles a Cuvée des Champions or Saint Gilloise in my opinion. Flavor starts out with some bright lemon and then immediately turns to the floral aspect of the beer. Its gentle grass and tartness....exceptionally balanced. Mouthfeel is light, carbonation is gentle, as well as the acidity, a moderate finish. Never had this before, but I am a big fan of this. I enjoy the floral character of the beer quite a bit and it adds some nice complexity to the lambic.

I havent had this beer since I visited the brewery a couple of years ago. Now I have the privilege of a bottle gifted to me from some family just returned (well, a few months ago!) from a trip to Brussels. Chilled this (from room temp) for about 8 mins in freezer and then 10-20 mins in fridge. I think that got it to about 50-60 F, which was recommended. In any case, poured it into some small tasting glasses (shared with a few people). It heads up like a champagne--quick up and down, but has a bit of linger. Definitely true to description with the darker gold pour, but aroma is all sour (not much hops--but maybe Ive been drinking too many CA IPAs lately). Very tart, very dry. Tough beer for the uninitiated. Finish has some chalkiness. Pleasant; good for pairing; can really cut against strong foods. I enjoyed this.

my least favorite of the offerings from Brussels. Feb12 bottling. It is unique from the regular gueuze. Harsh acidity, biting, bitter, citrus, funk, kinda dirty, lacking in mouthfeel to balance this out. Im sure this is right up your alley for some but not feeling it.
Pungent sour fruit aroma with hints of citrus. Cloudy orange color with a small white head. Tart beginning building to a strong sour finish.

15/VIII/2012 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ Erwins BBQ - bottled: 26/I/11 (2012-933) 
Little cloudy amber beer, small aery off-white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: bretta, lemony, pretty fruity, some wood, more bretta. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty sour, lemony, bretta flavours, grapefruit, pretty vinegar like sourness, wood, more lemon. Aftertaste: grapefruit, lemon, bretta notes, little fruity.

Apariencia: color ámbar claro, turbio, carbónico medio, corona escasa y desaparece rápido. 
Aroma: muy intenso, mucha manzana verde, sidra y muy funky, terroso, pero también más cítrico de lo habitual, también se nota bastante el grano. 
Sabor: muy intenso, cuerpo medio, mucha manzana verde, funky, sabe bastante a grano, agrio, pero final seco y ligeramente amargo, toque cítrico y herbal, salvaje y ligeramente vínica. Retrogusto larguísimo. Alcohol muy bien integrado. 
Pues eso, un auténtico lujo de cerveza, muy bien hecha, muy compleja, pero sorprendentemente fácil de beber. Creo que es el punto de partida perfecto para entender lo que son las lambic, ya que tiene todos los sabores de una forma muy pura, como muy cruda, pero sin ser excesivo. Lo que más me ha llamado la atención es que no hay ni rastro del habitual aroma y sabor a vinagre de Módena.
Like everything else Cantillon this was amazing. Subtle and nuanced and incredibly balanced. Slight sour notes and tannic mouthfeel. Vaguely fruity and floral. Amazing amazing stuff.

75cl bottle (2003) from Ølbutikken. Pours slightly hazy amber with a small white head. Delicious aroma of wild yeast, barnyard, fruit and malt with citrus and hints of hops. Sour and funky with a citric and lightly bitter finish. Dry and delicious!

Thanks Visionthing, 75 cl bottle.
Golden orange color, some foam.
Intense stable aromas
Medium body & high complexity.
High sourness & good bitterness .
Very enjoyable

Bottle. Dark golden, golden, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate and dry aroma, sourness, citrus fruitiness and some bitter hoppyness. Body is medium and dry with sour flavor, citrus - some grapefruit fruitiness, light hoppyness. Finish is average, dry and sour, citrus - some grapefruit fruitiness, hoppyness. Really nice lambic with fruitiness, citrus and bitter hoppyness. Aroma and flavor in balance.
Amber colour. Musty tart aroma. Taste is dry, some hops, and sour.

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere. Orange with a slightly off-white head. Sour aroma with rowan berries, apricots and  barnyard odour. Enamel-dissolving flavour with lots of sourness. Towards the end, malt and hops come through, but with the sourness remaining. A fine Lambic.

2007 vintage on tap at abbot's cellar in sf. Wow. Just wow. Another stellar beer from Cantillon. The all pale ale malt really brings out the acidity...and the fresh hopping is really noticeable. Delish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaske: Årgang 2003. Fin klar orange øl med en fantastisk duft af hestedække, men meget mellow. Selve smagen er igen sur, men på en utrolig balanceret og mellow måde. Dejlig dejlig sommerøl.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 Bottle at Nedre Foss Gård, december 19th 2015. Cloudy orange body with a small white head. Aroma is herbal with lemon and funk. Taste is dry and sour, grapes, oak, berries and forest. Pleasant sour finish and aftertaste. A very nice Cantillon.

Draught.
Pours a deep, cloudy straw, with a white head.
Complex, funky, hoppy aroma, malt, apricot, hay, citrus peel, brett, earth, apples.
Bone dry, medium body, low to medium bitterness, fairly low CO2 (appropriately so).
The taste is likewise funky and complex, with a marked acidity, malt, hops, citrus, hay, apples, brett, apricot.
Long, dry finish, with a lingering acidity and spicy hop notes.
(2012-07-18)

Bottle (2003 bottle), pours dark copper with small white head. Aroma is green apples, some hay, some hops, funk. Taste is green apples, floral, some hops, cantillon-funkyness. Tart, not as sour and vinegar as most cantillon.
350ml bottle shared by Ben, thanks man, it poured a light yellow color, with aromas of grass, light horse blanket, and some hay.  Flavors are the same, nice little sourness to it, very mellow.

750 bottle..2007 vintage bottled 2010.... poured into Cantillon tulip glass.... shared with Karin.... It pours murky dark golden with a large light orange head... The aroma is lemon, sour, grapefruits and flowers.... The flavor is sour, bitter lemon, grapefruits and acidic..... very nice crispy, dried fruit finish.....
2003 bottle. Nice sour aroma with a hint of grass. Deep golden color with a nice white head. Very nice citrus and grape flavors. Very nice sour but still balanced palate. Very nice.

Apricot color with fizzy head, musty, funky, lemon aroma.  Tastes of caramel malt, lemon, funk, chemicalish, bitter finish.  Crisp finish with a somewhat thicker consistency.  Unusual lambic, not my style.

Bottle-huge thanks to Daknole for sharing this fine brew.  Its funny, i didnt think i would like this however, i did quite a bit.  Pours lite orange with a fizzy white head.  WOW, huge sour nose-funk, barnyard, flowers, berries-so complex!  huge sourness on the flavors with berry fruity notes and biting tartness.  this is very complex-so much going on i cant really explain it.  all i know is that this beer is awesome and i wish i could have some more!

Good beer. Opended the bottle to find a little liquid beer on top of the cork and a little gas fizzing out thru it. Poured at good temperature with huge, fluffy, thick, cream-colored head that settled after a bit and some lace. Color is a clear amber with a single lazy bubble trail. Aroma is tart sweet with a barest hint of hop. Flavors like nose and again hop is in the background, more bitter. Body is a little soft as a result of low carbonation. Does have a few high point from the bitter/yeast combination, but its not offensive. Finish is like flavor and relatively long.

2011 decanted bottle to wine glass
Flowery hop and sour aromas. Cloudy amber with no head. Hoppy and sour don't go great together. Quite different.

A copperbrown beer with a quite big and blond head. Aroma is storgly sour, earthyness, green apples, spicyness. Taste is strongly sour, white wine, fermented berry juicy, leather, some flowers and spicyness. Medium- bodied, lots of carbonation, fresh, very sour and slightly sticky. Interesting, slightly Orval -like beer, strongly sour and sophisticated.

750 ml bottle, used a tulip glass. Big thanks to Wallace for sharing this bottle! Never been able to get my hands on a bottle. 2007 vintage bottled in 2010. 
Caramel color looking liquid, tiny head without retention. Nose is barnyard funk, hay and dried fruit. 
Really great mouth pucker. Lots going on the palate.
dry sour wood, gets funkier as it warms. However not in a over-bearing way. The age made it sweeter in a way. My first unblended Lambic. Real different from any other I had prior. Real nice.

2007 Vintage. Shared by Wally. enjoyed in a flute glass with friends. 

A - Excellent cloudy light brown. Nice and orange. Great bottom to top bubbles. No head at all. 

S - Loving the apple. Apple pie. Nice Acetic scent. Pine and Grapefruit.

T - Musty up front. Super high tannin taste from like dry grape skins. Baked pears incredible acetic sourness. The finish the oak grassiness. Incredible

M - 80% carbonation on the mouth swish. Incredibly light body. My taste buds are freaking out about the tart and sour. Like the mouthfeel of a lemon head on my tongue.

O - This is better than I expected. Great and worth seeking out. 

UPDATE: I decided to open my 2008 Vintage (bottled 2011) afterward to compare. Appearance is similar but slightly darker. scent is more oaky with less of the fruits I had in the last. yeah, Taste is still more oaky. More subtle acetic taste. Less sour taste. Less tart. Overall, its more subdued. Im for sure going to keep these for a year because I prefer it with another year on it. Really nice still though. Luckily, I have 4 more of these I think.

2007 vintage

A: Hazy orange, huge gushing head that fades rapidly, leaving minimal trace

S: Barnyard funk, hay, citrus fruits

T: Tart, as expected. Complex, intriguing, and certainly different from the other Cantillon brews I have had. Subtle citrus fruits with straw/hay flavors, wine-like tannins and a biting acidity, but not harsh. Iris is done so well (like all Cantillon brews), I find it quite enjoyable.

M: Dry and acetic finish

D: I would drink Iris anytime. Its always a good day when youre drinking Cantillon.
750 ml bottle from 16th St. Pours an amber orange with large head. Aroma of fresh cut wood. Acidic and sour. Mix of citrus and red berry flavors.  Lingering bitter and sour notes.

Bottled 2011. Pours a cloudy amber, with a white fluff head which quickly dies to a fine lace. Aromas of citric fruits, pink grapefruit, orange, lemon & lime peel, hops, sweet malt, graham cracker, slight vinegar and a little funk from the ageing. Taste is very bitter & wonderfully acidic, like sucking a fresh pink grapefruit, mouth puckeringly good & fresh, and with a slight sweetness from the malt helping to cut through. Very fresh & cleansing on the palate, thanks to the great acidity & subtle carbonation leading to a long dry, clean bitter finish.
Very bitter, dry, potpourri, cheesy sour crackers. Flavor is bitter, chalky, and has a mushroom peppery undertone

15/06/2012 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Dorata, torbida, schiuma biancastra poco abbondante e per nulla persistente. Al naso intense note acide, di muffa, cantina, stalla, vacui sentori erbacei. In bocca è acida, decisa, tagliente, ma straordinaria per intensità ed equilibrio. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Nonostante al naso non sia pulitissima, in bocca è straordinaria. Uno dei migliori lambic mai bevuti.

Bottle from Nightfall. Thanks a ton Alex! Shared with weihenheizen. Pour is a little darker than I anticipated color with a crisp white head. Aroma is in your face acidity, like that of an crab apple are perhaps Im thinking more along the lines of an unripe, hard grape. Either way, its  got a super dry, sour bit to it that just keeps on going. Taste is all dry sourness, but I really like it. This beer is definitely an interesting experience and the star of the evenings beers. Thanks again, Alex.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 Refrigerated green bottle poured into a white wine glass at Jeremys Friday tasting.  Pours deep golden at top and goes to light golden at the bottom with a couple finger widths of head that dissapates down to a nice cover.  Nice small bubble lacing, low carbonation, medium body, and tart aroma.  Taste is sour, some oak, and bitter floral finish.  The primary reason for the tasting and this completes all 73 styles for me, thanks a lot Jeremy.  Great beer.

2012-06-02.
Flowers and fruit in aroma. A heavy load of citrus and a soft touch of cellar. 
Pours a hazy, orange brew. Quickly dissolving head.
A powerful bite in taste which is substantially sour, almost vomit-like (sorry for the metaphor). 
Bitterness as from grape-fruit peel (a bit to heavy) and tastes from lemon pulp. Magnificent! Associations to limestone/chalk and lactic acid.
A slight hint of sweetness balances the brew perfectly.
The aftertaste follows up with tropical tones.

Tap @ Fairbar. Pours slightly hazy golden with a small ring of white foam. Aroma of sweet fruits, oranges, barnyard, dusty, grapes. brett. Taste is medium sour fruity, orange- and lemonpeel, barnyard, oak brett, dusty. Thin body, soft corbonation, dry sour finish. Nice and easy drinking. 010612
I got it in the brewery without CO². It tastes sour, bitter, fruity, a bit citrus. Not easy to drink but ok. 10/9/9/9/-/9

75cl 2011 bottle split with a friend. The pours deep hazy orange with no head. The nose is light floral, plenty of lemon and orange. Some spun sugar, delicate barnyard and yeasty funk. The taste is hoppy bitter lemon rind, aggressive grapefruit citrus, tart fruits and sugar. This is ballasted by a chalky light lactic sourness. Nice depth, bright and sweet. Light and easy to drink. Soft carbonation. Overall, very nice.

Bottled 3/8/11. Vibrant golden pour with a small white head. Aroma is very funky and full of brett - leather, citrus, grapefruit, sweet notes of Turkish delights, pineapple, orange - almost like a tropical fruit bowl. A hint of vanilla and musty oak. A hint of balsamic acetid quality, blending in very nicely. I love the aroma. The taste is tart - brett, lactic acid and oak at the forefront. Fruity wild yeast complexity of grapes, lemon zest and additional notes of barnyard and leather. The balance between sweetness and tartness is sooo good, the palate is dry and fresh. It might be the dry hopping that does it, the tropical fruitiness and pungency that makes this so special. But hot dang, this is good.

750 ml bottle bought @ Bierkompass.de. Pours hazy orange white a frothy offwhite head that is rather quick to dissipate while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is fullbodied and sour with lemon juice, wood, gooseberries, red currants, vinegar, hay, leather, dark grapes, horse blanket, silage and hints of white pepper, lemon zest, orange peal and resin. Taste is sour with lots of wood, red currants, gooseberries, lemon zest, orange peal, leather, hay, barnyard, resin, sour cherries, peaches, lemon juice, orange juice and hints of white pepper, dry soil, vinegar and horse blanket. Mouthfeel is dry, tart and medium bodied. Finish is sour and tart with resinous wood, red currants, sour cherries, hay, lemon juice and vinegar.

75 cl bottle. Bottled on 26.01.2011.
Originally rated on 20100401. (7+4+8+4+15)
Pours hazy dark orange color with small head. Aroma of sour fruits, goose berry bush, nettle, apples, rose hip, barnyard notes and some grapes. Flavor of goose berries, grapes, sour fruits, yeast and rowan berries. Very dry, sour and berryish palate with a dry finish. Very nice.
3465

Bottle sample at a tasting at Rotems place. Thanks beerandbeyond. Cloudy orange-amber with  minimal white film. Delicate cider vinegar and limestone aroma, extremely sour, pickle juice! Medium body, smooth texture, short finish. Weird but strangely fine.
Pours hazy deep amber with thin white head. Raspberry balsamic nose with a touch of brett. Sour and Fruity with slight citrus hops, white rinded cheese and a Sharp finish
la iris sono gusti acidi e amari che si uniscono in bocca in maniera molto piacevole. laspetto invitante e lodore molto pungente fa di questa una delle migliori firmate cantillon.

Iris 2004. Bottle date: 8 May 2008, BB 2015
Clear, warm golden colour, white diminishing head. Aroma of barn, sweat, hops, dried figs, turkish delight, citrus and fresh quark cheese. Balanced flavour, sour and tart, quite warm, light bitter. Warm, balanced, tart finish.
The hops really give this beer an extra punch, even when it has been in the bottle for as long as this one has. Utterly lovely.
(From 75cL bottle @ home)
Deep golden pour with frothy white head. Aroma is just hay and funk. Flavor is very tart/acidic a bit are barnyard, and some bread. Medium body with light carbonation.
Sampled at an esbls tasting.  Clear honey gold.  I keep trying these.  I should just give up.

What a lovely orange amber colour! A small white head. Acidic, fruity and weak citric aroma. Acidic flavour like immature apples. Also light sweet.  A bit citric and fruity. Well mixed stuff.[Bottle. 2007 version. Trade with Mr Grima. Thanks a lot man. Great stuff!]
Frisk men alldeles för syrligt för min tunga när jag avnjöt detta spontanjästa öl.

75cl, Mi orge mi houblon. Ive heard this beer described as the UNESCO World Heritage of beers and I agree. Dull copper slightly hazy. Sour, moreish, very lemony, malt warm. Mouth is sour, pollen, lemon, green, woodiness hoppy, dry. Dryness carries through to the finish, hoppy end, balances the infection of the lambication so well.

Pour clear, golden amber, with a small white head. Nice and spakeling. 
Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, acid, sour apples. 
Taste is bitter up front, with a nice and sour whip on the tongue. A bit like sour candy. 
Medium watery body, with a slight fizzy carb.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 1996 Bottle. Came up dark golden honey with a thin head that lingered. Heavy full mellow sour. Well blended flavors. Very sour but the body itself seems to balance it out. Aged quite well.
Bottle from Ølbutikken. Cloudy amber. Oaky, earthy, barnyard funky, citrus-y, hoppy, grassy. Medium body, not as much puckering on my part as Im used to.

750ml bottle courtesy of mr. huxley... Pours a somewhat transparent bright copper penny brown and topped with a thin to medium creamy white head that quickly reduces to a thin film...Grassy bitter nose with more horsey funk through the middle and finish. Pungent in a way that I havent experienced from cantillon before... Flavors are more of the same with a fairly pronounced grassy bitterness late through the middle and backend.

Bottle pour at Erzbierschof, vuntagr 2000. Pours a cloudy orange with a white head. Smells sweet, some subtle fruit, horse blanket, goodness. Tastes; f umami, medium sweetness, sour. Medium bodied, nearly absent carbonation, oily texture. Finishes acetic, with some dryness. Amazing beer, with none of the original hop notes.

Lovely.  Biscuit malt with strong lemon citrus finish. Barnyard leather saddle with clean dry finish. I just love this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

reviewed 12-15-2010. vintage 2005, served in a Bruery tulip. pours a nice dull hazy orange with slight brown and yellow tones. little to no head, very light retention. light lemon and earthy notes. light oak and funk. scent was a bit faint. i pick up lots of lemon and a hint of lime. not as tart and puckering as most cantillon i have had. an underlying sweetness and funk carry through out. i pick up a nice light pineapple flavor throughout the finish. I was going to say this was a 4.0, but i am really digging this pineapple flavor in the end. moderate carbonation. light dryness. the oak comes alive the most in the mouthfeel. great stuff, not sure why i waited so long on this but time treated it well. i will be buying more for sure.

Glass at DBS anniversary night (after bowling a 604 series and winning 4 games to none).  Aroma is of bitter fruit (lime/grapefruit mix) and Brett. Flavor is the same, but tame on the front end and bitter on the back (but still ends fairly quickly with slight linger). The palate is excellent. I've heard about Cantillon, but this is my first. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2013 Bottle 750ml.
Pours clear brown/dark golden, with almost no head, fully diminishing. Aroma is of funk, sweet, hops, and pine. Taste sour, funky, hoppy, acid, and sligth citrus. A very good and refreshing lambic. Way less sour than usual other lambic-based beers. Somewhat sweet, very drinkable. [Further notes: drank a 2003 (near 10 years old): indeed hops have faded, but the beer is well preserved. No clear improvement here.]

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 Multiple times from bottle (750 ml) and tap. 

Appearance: Slightly hazy orange/golden with a small mostly lasting off-white head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Oak, strong but not overpowering floral presence, barnyard, herbal presence, brettanomyces and dusty notes.

Taste: Wood, barnyard, moderate sourness, citric notes, quite floral too, herbal notes and dust. Light to moderate bitterness.

Palate: Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Dry and woodsy finish.  

Overall: When fresh, I think I slightly prefer it on draft but it also become stellar in bottle after a few years (its still amazing fresh). Amazing drinkability with a good complexity and superb balance. Nice cohesion between the floral presence, the citric notes, the barnyard, the oak and the hops. Superb!

10-MAR-2012, 2003 bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer".
Doubble sealed - nice whoof sound on opening.
Slightly hazy orange with off-white head.
Nose is very bretty with a fruity touch. - oranges.
Taste is red wine-like, bretty and tart.
Quite long aftertaste. Creamy and low carbonation.
Did expect it to be more sour, but fantastic, creamy and smooth.

From notes.  First reviewed 9/26/2011.  2006 Vintage. Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a tasting glass.

The pour is a golden caramel color with a delicate white head. A few spots of lace stick to the glass.

Lilac, some hay, and a good amount of barnyard funk provide the base of the aroma. An omnipresent sour aroma is there as well.

The taste is both fairly sour and also brashly bitter. These two sensations together are not very pleasant. There is a lemon zest sour flavor to go with the light malts, but as the flavor transitions to bitterness I feel like I am chewing on flowers. Overall it is a tart, funky, and flowery taste. 

The body has dried out a fair amount while retaining a light oiliness. Medium bodied with light to medium carbonation.

This combination of flavors really did not do it for me. I prefer their other sours.

2006 Bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pours amber with an off white head that dissipates to a ring. Aroma is stellar - cherries, hay, funk, lemon. Medium bodied with a fine spritzy carbonation. Flavor of pale Belgian wheat malts in the background, with complex flavors of lemon, funk, flower petals, and green apple. Good amount of acidity without going over the top. Sour, acetic finish that is about a 8.0 out of 10 on the mouth puckering scale. I am shocked at how well this is drinking. I am not a fan of cellaring beer, but this is one of the few exceptions. Amazing beer.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2013 2007 vintage.  750ml bottle from Tap and Mallet. Pours a clear amber with little head, although I do notice some carbonation bubbles streaming from the bottom.  Aroma of funk, lemon grass, earthy notes.  Taste is sour grapefruit with citrus, pepper, with a huge dose of funk and sourness.  Noticeable hop note.  Outstanding.

2007 Vintage bottle shared at Olympen
Pours redish golden hazy with a white head. Smells of brett, mint, apple and some yeast. Taste has wheat, some sweetness but then comes the raw brutal sour acids. This sure isnt a balanced one. Alot of elements from the aroma also accompanies here. Quite light body and flat carbonation.

Dark, hazy gold with thin off-white head.  Tart and more malty than the avg lambic.  Light musty aroma.

Notes: 10 Bottle at the Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 10

Bottle, 2006 vintage, 03/03/2012.  Pours transparent amber, huge rocky head recedes within a minute or so, some soapy lacing.  Funky, musty nose with leather, opens into earthy lemon, tart, grass, yeast, hops.  Taste tart and sour with grapefruit juice, lemon,  wood, funky with dry bitter finish, subtle malts.  Palate is medium, smooth despite the tartness, and dry.  Delicious stuff, the hop bitterness manages to balance out the initial pucker to achieve a nice balance.
Une odeur florale et un peu sucré.  Le sucre se fait très discret en bouche car le goût dominant est sûr et acide mais complexe et rafraîchissant.  Une expérience unique.
